title: Nursing Office Liaison - Administrative Assistant
description:
**The salary for this position will be $21.98 - $24.73 hourly / FT 35 hours a week**


**Job Summary**  

Are you organized, a problem solver, and great at multitasking and customer service? QSAC is looking for an Office Liaison for our Nursing Department. This position supports the medical coordinators who ensure the people we support are receiving appropriate medical care.


**Job Responsibilities**


**Administration**


* Oversee medical coordinators and ensure appointments are made in a timely manner
* Review and ensure paperwork received from medical providers is accurate and appropriate
* Provide problem solving support to medical coordinators who are with the people receiving services at medical appointments and in their programs
* Manage medical appointment calendars
* Ensure residential programs, day habilitation programs, people we support and their families are aware of upcoming medical appointments
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management


**Qualifications & Work Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree highly preferred or related administrative experience required
* 1-2 years supervisory experience required
* Experience in a medical setting required (medical receptionist, medical coordinator, hospital, etc)
* Excellent organizational skills are essential
* Maintain individual /family confidentiality
* Commitment to company values and adherence to policies is essential
* Excellent customer service skills are required
* Ability to juggle multiple tasks with flexibility
* Dependability and flexibility is expected
* Excellent interpersonal skills are required
* Working knowledge Microsoft Office is required


**Mission**



QSAC is a New York City and Long Island based nonprofit that supports children and adults with autism, together with their families, in achieving greater independence, realizing their future potential, and contributing to their communities in a meaningful way by offering person-centered services. QSAC pursues this mission through direct services that provide a supportive and individualized setting for children and adults with autism to improve their communication, socialization, academic, and functional skills.

  


**Benefits**  

Our benefits go beyond health and retirement. You will be joining a passionate community of professionals and staff who support each other in a challenging and rewarding work culture.


* Competitive salary
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance have very low out of pocket costs (for FT staff)
* Medical can be as low as $1 dollar per paycheck / $26 dollars a year for full medical coverage ( for FT staff)
* Generous Paid Time Off policy (for full time staff) Start with 24 days annually
* Group Life Insurance and Long Term Disability (for FT staff)
* Flexible Spending Accounts (for FT staff)
* Defensive Driving pay incentive (for positions that require driving)
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits
* 403(b) Retirement with Employer Match
* Paid Training in the field of human services and ABA
* Opportunities for career advancement
* Qualifications are subject to change in accordance with government regulations.


* We adhere to all strict COVID guidelines at all of our programs and sites.



Qualifications are subject to change in accordance with government regulations.


* This description is a general statement of required major duties and responsibilities performed on a regular and continuous basis. It does not exclude other duties as assigned.



QSAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).


**Mission-Oriented. Results-Driven. Collaborative. Passionate. We Are QSAC.**

  



To easily apply: please send resume to jobs@qsac.com
company_addresses:
253 West 35th Street, 14th Floor
New York, NY 10001
company_description: QSAC is a non-profit organization that provides services to 2,500+ children and adults with autism in New York City and Long Island.
ceo_name: Lisa A. Veglia, LCSW, M.P.A., SAS

title: Event Support
description:
*Manhatta is a love letter to New York City. Perched 60 floors up, embodying the spirit of a tried-and-true New Yorker, Manhatta is rooted in and inspired by the people that gravitate here. Bringing a deep collection of international wines and spirits and a relaxed dinner menu to the heart of the financial district, Manhatta is the party you’ll want to return to night after night.*


**Who you are:**

The Event Support team member is an hourly team member who delivers thorough and thoughtful hospitality and service. They support the Server and Captains by nurturing positive team and guest interactions, which leads to exceeding guest expectations. You have great communication skills, strong work ethic, and a knowledgeable passion for food and beverage service. The ability to interact with staff, clients and other stakeholders in a fast-paced environment while remaining flexible, proactive, efficient, and reliable is crucial to this role. The ideal candidate exudes a high level of professionalism and hospitality expertise at all times.


**What you’ll do:**


* Possess an understanding of proper steps of service and consistently executes them with efficiency and grace, while maintaining a sense of urgency throughout service
* Anticipate and respond to guest needs
* Ensure constant communication with Event Captains, staff members, management and the kitchen during service
* Maintain the high standards of cleanliness and proper appearance throughout all areas of event venues
* Reliably complete all assigned set up and breakdown tasks
* Demonstrate knowledge of Department of Health (DOH) and USE’s health and safety standards
* Demonstrate a desire to learn more about the event and work as a team
* Demonstrate basic guest recognition skills—can identify USE and USHG leadership, key clients, and event hosts
* Show understanding of all service styles (ex: reception, buffet, seated, coat check)
* Demonstrate appropriate tableside and guest interaction manner
* Works effectively and safely with team members to complete set up and break down tasks and service


**What we need from you:**


* Catering/fine-dining experience is helpful; service and hospitality-oriented attitude a must
* On-demand availability
* TIPS Certification (preferred)
* NYC Food Handler’s Certificate (preferred)


**What you’ll get from us:**


* Hourly rate of $30/hr
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Paid Time Off to support you with an active life outside of work
* Paid Parental Leave
* 51% dining discount throughout the USHG family of restaurants
* Flexible Spending Options (health care, dependent care, transit & parking)
* Employee Assistance Program to support overall mental wellbeing
* Exclusive access to primary care, mental health, and other healthcare services through Radish Health
* Matched 401(k) to help you invest in your future
* Generous Employee Referral Program
* Access to the USHG HUGS Employee Relief Fund

title: Dental Receptionist
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Bonus based on performance
* Employee discounts
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off
* Profit sharing

  

**Dental Receptionist**  

South Island Periodontics & Implantology – Cedarhurst, NY  

**Job description**  

*Dental Receptionist*  

Our busy practice is searching for another great team member. Our office is a state of the art facility that delivers 5 star care to our patients. We pride ourselves on our efficient and kind customer service. Most of our business comes from patient word of mouth. Over the years we have built an excellent reputation for high quality dentistry with excellent customer service. Our team members are not only caring and welcoming to our patients they are also caring and kind co-workers. We feel that a happy team makes for a happy work environment for our staff and a positive experience for our patients. Most of our staff members are working here for many years. It is our wish to continue building our team with the kind of people that really care and are patient and kind.  

  

**Front desk skills / tasks:**  

* Excellent customer service skills
* Answering phones, checking in and checking out patients
* Making appointments, taking payments, arranging payment plans
* Balancing all payment types at the end of the day
* Assist in updating and maintaining client dental records
* Greet customers and help to answer any questions they might have
* Provide support to dentists, surgeons, and staff as needed
* Prevent the spread of infection and disease by maintaining a clean work environment
* Using the following software programs daily: Dentrix, Dexis, Weave, Rectangle Health, Prexion, Mconsent, Eprescribe and Gmail
* Dental insurance verification, submission and receiving insurance payments
* Strong Dentrix skills are very valuable

**Benefits:**  

Medical insurance is available through our office for purchase by the employee (pre-tax)  

Paid time off - legal holidays and other holidays / Sick time are benefits earned after the probationary period is over. Paid Vacation time is earned after 1 year and 3 years  

  

Flexible schedule - Our office is open Monday - Friday and alternating Sundays at a total of almost 50 hours a week. Schedules are made based on the office's needs for full time 35-40 scheduled hours / week.  

  

Job Type: Full-time  

Salary: $25.00 - $34.00 per hour (more experience = higher pay)  

Benefits:  

* 401(k)
* Disability insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:  

* 5 - 10hr shifts depending on the weekday
* Monday to Friday & alternating Sunday's are also available

title: Pre-op / PACU Registered Nurse - Full Time [$50-$55/hr]
description:
**About us**

Mountain Surgery Center specializes in spine procedures and pain management interventions. With a team of dedicated professionals and state-of-the-art facilities, we provide exceptional care to our patients. Our surgery center features 4 operating rooms and operates Monday through Saturday, offering a supportive and collaborative environment for our staff.

**Position Overview**

We are seeking a skilled Pre-op/PACU Nurse to join our team. The ideal candidate will have more than one year of Pre-op/PACU or critical care experience. A current New Jersey Registered Nurse license and BLS/ACLS certifications are required.

Requirements:

* Ability to work **3 or more** Saturdays per month
* Valid RN license in the state of New Jersey
* 1 year of experience as a Pre-op/PACU or critical care nurse and be **excellent at IVs**
* Must have current BLS and ACLS
* Must possess a knowledge of surgical procedures and management of the surgical patient
* Previous experience in an ambulatory surgical center strongly preferred
* Friendly, organized, and dependable
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks efficiently

Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Medical Specialty:

* Surgery

Physical Setting:

* Ambulatory surgery center
* Outpatient

License/Certification:

* NJ RN License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: PT Revenue Recovery Supervisor - Nassau/Melville/Yonkers
description:
**Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.**


Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

**Job Description:**

**NOTE: This position entail traveling, conducting tests on dimensional billing equipment within the time range of 9AM-2PM. The regular schedule can vary depending on the needs of the company and coverage requirements. Applicants should have reliable transportation, be open to occasional travel to different facilities, and maintain a flexible schedule. Reimbursement will be provided for travel miles. The role involves a physical component as well as specific office duties.**


This position trains and supervises the daily activities of employees. They ensure all assigned duties are accomplished safely and timely. This position generates and audits reports using various systems. This position completes calibration testing, replaced component acceptance testing, and annual acceptance testing. This position generates and audits reports using various systems. They open service logs with TSG or vendor, follow up on open service logs, and cleans equipment. They perform other duties as assigned.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Supervises and trains employees.
* Conducts audits of procedures and methods to generate reports.
* Performs required daily calibration testing on all DWS units in the facility during hub downtime.
* Reviews calibration testing results and ensure all DWS units have passed testing before placing into production.
* Opens service orders with TSG or vendor on any DWS units that fail calibration testing.
* Follows up on all open and existing service orders.
* Retests all DWS units after they have been repaired.
* Performs required cleaning per schedule.
* Assists with annual acceptance testing.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree or International equivalent - Preferred
* Meets local age and operations requirements to operate a vehicle
* The candidate must be experienced in Access, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
* Availability to work flexible shift hours, up to 5 days per week
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Ability to work in a fast-paced office and warehouse environment.

**Employee Type:**


Permanent
UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

**Other Criteria:**

UPS is an equal opportunity employer. UPS does not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

**Basic Qualifications:**


Must be a U.S. Citizen or National of the U.S., an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. for this employer.

**Pay Range:**


Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $25.20/hr to $40.95/hr. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to, market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and education/training and a candidate’s work experience. Hired applicants are offered annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs, subject to applicable eligibility requirements. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance. The company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements. Medical/prescription drug coverage, Dental coverage, Vision coverage, Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance & Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Disability Income Protection Plan, Employee Assistance Program, 401(k) retirement program, Vacation, Paid Holidays and Personal time, Paid Sick and Family and Medical Leave time as required by law, and Discounted Employee Stock Purchase Program.

title: Package Delivery Driver
description:
**SHIFT YOUR FUTURE**


Package Delivery Driver


**SHIFT YOUR TEAM**


**Who exactly are UPS Package Delivery Drivers?**

They’re the ones who drive our familiar brown trucks, bringing packages great and small to our customers. They’re a friendly, physically active crew who enjoy fast-paced work, being outdoors, and being behind the wheel!


**SHIFT YOUR SKILLS**


**So, what does it take to make it through a busy shift delivering boxes of all shapes and sizes to homes and businesses in your community and beyond?**

* The ability to lift up to 70 lbs.
* Valid driver’s license—no CDL required (License type varies by state)
* Pass the DOT physical
* Excellent customer service and driving skills
* Legal right to work in the U.S.
* Package Delivery Drivers are expected to comply with UPS appearance guidelines and wear the company-provided uniform

Full-time UPS employees work eight to ten hours per day and workdays can vary (Monday - Friday) or (Tuesday - Saturday) depending on the business needs.


**SHIFT YOUR BENEFITS**


**What’s in it for you?**


* Excellent weekly pay
* Growth opportunities
* Extensive training
* 401(k)
* Defined-benefit pension plan
* Medical, dental, and vision after waiting period
	+ $0 healthcare premium
* Paid vacation
* Paid Sick and Family and Medical Leave time as required by law
* Paid holidays
* Discounted Employee Stock Purchase Program
* Employee Assistance Program

**SHIFT YOUR PURPOSE**


**So, what is UPS all about?** Well, you’re probably already familiar with us – we’re the brown trucks delivering everything from diapers, dish towels and holiday gifts, to college care packages and life-saving medicines.


But we’re more than that. We’re also hardworking, efficient package handlers and friendly, focused drivers. We’re professionals working in finance, technology, engineering, marketing, and more. We are building our business ethically, sustainably, and in an environmentally conscientious way. And we are here to deliver what matters—to customers, communities, colleagues, the world, and you and your career. Come work for an award-winning company. Make the Shift to UPS.


This job posting includes information about the minimum qualifications (including the UPS Uniform and Personal Appearance Guidelines), locations, shifts, and operations within the locations which may consider my application. An applicant or employee may request an exception or change to, or an accommodation of, any condition of employment (including the UPS Uniform and Personal Appearance Guidelines) because of a sincerely held religious belief or practice.

  


The base pay for this position is $23.00/hour  

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation. UPS is an equal opportunity employer. UPS does not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Store Associate (Part Time) - Lake Grove, NY
description:
**Salary**
----------

$19.00/hr plus benefits


**Location**
------------

Store
  

2900 Middle Country Rd
  

Lake Grove, NY 11755 USA
**Employment Type**
-------------------

Part-Time

--------------------

Entry Level
**Employment Area**
-------------------

Grocery
**Reference number**
--------------------

460553
**Target Start Date**
---------------------

09/16/2024
**Summary**
-----------



Store Associates provide our customers with the shopping experience that Lidl is famed for in 30 countries. You won’t be just a stocker or cashier. You will be involved in every part of the store’s operations, including stocking, cleaning, bakery operations, non-food merchandising, and more! Our most successful Store Associates thrive in a fast-paced environment and are open-minded to different ways of doing business. They know that open communication and feedback is integral to professional development. Most of all, they are passionate about our core business – providing our customers with high-quality, low-price, and hassle-free shopping.

**What You’ll Do**
------------------


* Unpack stock as deliveries arrive in store, maintaining a quick pace
* Provide excellent customer service, not only on the registers but throughout the store by helping customers with questions and locating items for them
* Ensure that the entire store is clean and organized throughout your shift, from the parking lot, to the sales floor, to the breakroom and warehouse
* Expand your knowledge of our business by learning and completing tasks in our bakery, produce area, and weekly promotional set-up
* Communicate clearly with management and colleagues to complete tasks as needed, overall team player
**What You’ll Need**
--------------------


* Must be 18 years or older
* Ability to lift, move, carry, or slide product over 50 pounds
* Ability to reach above head to heights greater than 10 inches
* The flexibility to start an early shift at 5am or finish a late shift at 11pm, including weekends
* A positive attitude in the face of changing priorities
* A friendly communication style with your team and customers
* The drive to work hard in a fast-paced environment
**What You’ll Receive**
-----------------------



At Lidl, we know that in order for our people to do their best, they must be at their best. That’s why as a company, we offer one of the most generous benefits packages in the industry.


All our Lidl employees, regardless of hourly status, are eligible to receive the following benefits:

* Starting pay of $19.00 per hour
* Medical & Prescription | Dental | Vision coverage
* Paid Time Off (PTO) to use for sickness or vacation
* Dedicated training plans to ensure you are set up for success
* 401k Plan (+ 5% company match)
* Voluntary Term Life & AD&D Insurance
* Total Well-Being Program
* DailyPay, a voluntary benefit to offer employees access to their pay on their own schedule
company_description: Lidl is a family-owned business grounded on a simple philosophy: that customers deserve the highest quality products at unbelievably low prices.

title: PPG - Human Resources Generalist
description:
PPG is an EPC contractor specializing in the installation of utility and industrial process infrastructure including substations, power generation, industrial process facilities, and renewable fuel projects. PPG utilizes a motivated team of in-house subject matter experts, construction managers, project managers, engineers, and project staff to manage the execution of the engineering, procurement, and construction of various projects.  

  

PPG is currently planning, negotiating and executing EPC contracts for large electrical infrastructure projects, including HVDC substations, and complex industrial projects in the western US, targeting a start date of 3Q/4Q 2024. PPG is seeking to hire a Human Resources Generalist stationed in the PPG Paramus Headquarters.  

  

**PRIMARY FUNCTION**  

The Human Resources Generalist will run the daily functions of the Human Resource (HR) department and will form partnerships across the organization to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflects the business objectives of the organization.  

  

**TYPICAL RESPONSIBILITIES*** Handles employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, and supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the HR Director
* Attends and participates in employee disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations
* Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including but not limited to compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; and training and development
* Assists with the new hire onboarding process by collecting new hire information, initiating background checks and preemployment drug screens, prepping conference rooms and benefits guides for new hire orientation, and updating all employee records
* Schedules employees for drug testing utilizing third party system
* Processes all E-Verify requests to determine new hires’ eligibility to work in the U.S.
* Maintains filing systems and executes proper record keeping practices to ensure confidentiality of HR information as well as compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices
* Collects and enters employee data to a variety of systems with an emphasized focus for maintaining accuracy and meeting deadlines
* Schedules travel as requested by the HR and Operations departments
* Conducts new hire orientation for all new hires
* Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance
* Maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law
* Adheres to internal standards, policies, and procedures
* Performs special projects and completes other duties as assigned or requested

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION*** Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
* 5+ years’ experience working within multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational development, employee relations, performance management, and federal and state employment laws

**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION*** PHR certification

**SKILLS*** Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
* Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite

  

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS*** Travel: Yes
* Percent of Time: 10%

title: Part Time Receptionist for High End Medical Spa

description:
We are looking for a high-energy full time front desk receptionist for our new medical spa location in Holmdel. Background on aesthetic services is a plus! We will train on all services.

Current Hours are Tuesday-Friday 9:00AM-5:00PM and every other Saturday 9:00AM-4:00PM.

Responsibilities will include the following:

Answering phone and scheduling patients as needed

Assisting the medical providers

title: Care Manager
description:
Overview of Organization:

For more than 40 years Argus Community, Inc. has successfully brought-together and developed outstanding people, resources, and programs in the pursuit of an ambitious mission: To provide on-going and continuously improved methods of substance abuse, health, and mental treatments and preventions that restore the lives of the many underserved New York City-area families, men, women, and adolescents who come through our doors each year.

**Job Title:** Care Manager

**Job Summary:**

As a Care Manager your function is to act as a leader in providing appropriate care management services to approximately 50 active clients according to the guidelines set out in the ACCESS Program Manual (and as required by the NYSDOH – HH, AIDS Institute).

*Duties & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*

* Be familiar with the ACCESS Program Manual (with particular attention to the specific functions of the Care Manager 1 position). This manual was created in accordance with procedures based upon AIDS institute NYSDOH and Health Home guidelines
* Complete an in-depth screening, intake, and initial assessment; subsequently completing and overseeing a client-focused care plan, detailed and mutually developed with each participant
* Implementation of the care plan with documented follow-up and monitoring of the plan
* Advocacy and knowledge of available and appropriate services for participants and their families/collaterals
* Conduct home visits as required and as needed (with a minimum of one home visit per care plan period)
* Conduct regular case conferences with outside providers on an as-need basis (NOTE: Care Manager 1 must ensure that at least one case conference is conducted at least once per service plan period for every client).
* Being available for crisis intervention, having to remain with a client until the issue is resolved or addressed
* Complete accurate and up to date documentation and consents for services Conduct daily follow ups to address any issues, review the previous day's activities, and to discuss any client issues and/or new insights regarding a particular client
* Be knowledgeable and up-to-date in areas pertaining to HIV / AIDS symptoms and medications, also other chronic illnesses.
* Be able to work in and create a positive environment, manage providers, delegate and oversee tasks/duties, and address conflicts as they arise.
* Communicate effectively with supervisory personnel in a cooperative and supportive manner.
* Maintain monthly per member per month billing standards, meeting one of the 5 core Health Home functions.
* Complete HCBS Waiver Form if they do not meet the criteria to provide HCBS services
* Complete the New York State Eligibility Assessment for clients who are deemed eligible for HCBS services. If a client is found eligible for HCBS services, Health Home Care Managers must complete the New York State Community Mental Health Assessment (CMHA).
* Create an individual-centered plan of care that integrates behavioral and physical health services and includes HCBS for clients who are found eligible.
* Coordinate with a client’s Managed Care Organization (MCO’s) in order to ensure a client receives the HCBS service(s) they are eligible for.

**Qualifications:**

To perform the job of Care Manager successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The qualifications listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job of Care Manager.

* Minimum of one year of direct case management experience\\*
* Knowledge of HIV / AIDS transmission and treatment and other chronic illnesses
* Meets physical and cognitive requirements needed to complete assigned tasks and duties of the position with reasonable accommodations being made for individuals with disabilities.
* Ability to travel within the five boroughs of New York City via public transportation
* Ability to demonstrate proper judgment and decision making skills when necessary
* Excellent written, verbal, and organizational skills
* Ability to manage time effectively
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred
* Knowledge of computers/word processing a plus

\\*Direct Care Management experience includes verifiable full/part-time care management or case work with the following populations: those with HIV/AIDS, or a history of mental illness, homelessness, or chemical dependence. Experience with families or groups preferred; experience with HRA, HASA, hospitals or clinics a plus. Qualifying experience does not include activities or job positions such as pastoral counseling, counseling, therapeutic activities, internships or any unpaid/volunteer positions.

**Education:**

* A bachelor’s degree in any of the following: child & family studies, community mental health, counseling, education, nursing, occupational therapy, physical therapy, psychology, recreation, recreational therapy, rehabilitation, social work, sociology, or speech and hearing;
* Bachelor’s level education or higher in any field with five years of experience working directly with persons with behavioral health diagnoses;
* OR a Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC).

Please visit our website: www.arguscommunity.org for information about the company.

* Compensation competitive; based on clinical ability & experience.
* Excellent benefits, including Major Medical, Dental, Pension match after 1 year.
* Close to all public transportation.

We are a Drug-Free Workplace. All candidates are subject to a drug test.

NYC law prohibits us from requiring you to share information about your current or past salary. Although we may discuss salary expectations with you, you should not interpret any of our questions as seeking or requiring information about your current or past salary.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Experience:

* related job: 3 years (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Bronx, NY 10456 (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Preferred)

title: Retail Cashier
description:
**Who We Are:**

TESO Group was founded in May 2017 in Queens, New York. In February 2018, the group's first store TESO LIFE opened for business. With rapid development, the group became a leading enterprise in the industry. There are three major retail brands and a private brand running by the group now, including department store - TESO LIFE, convenience store - TESO MINl, collectible toy store - TESO-X and private brand -MONKIMON.

We are a Japanese fashion casual life product department store. TESO LIFE collaborates with a number of well-known Japanese suppliers and developers to provide high quality, diverse, convenient products and efficient services to its customers. Committing to providing global consumers with truly "high-quality, creative, low-cost" products. We strive to lead in the fashion, leisure, and consumer frontier market with its "Affordable Premium Product" style.

**Job Overview:** We are looking for a Retail Cashier for a Japanese fashion leading company. In this role, you will engage and connect with our customers by providing excellent customer service. You will handle payments and ensure accurate accounting of all transactions, collections and disbursements. You will contribute to the retail store's success with your attention to detail, great communication skills, and ability to operate in a fast-paced environment.

* Operate the cash register to accurately process customer purchases.
* Ensuring correct prices and applying any applicable discounts or promotions.
* Handle cash transactions securely and accurately, following proper procedures to prevent discrepancies or losses.
* Assist customers in locating products, answering inquiries, and providing product recommendations.
* Keep the cashier area clean, organized, and free from clutter.
* Restock bags, receipt paper, and other supplies as needed.
* Assist with general store maintenance tasks, such as restocking merchandise or arranging displays, when required.
* Develop a solid understanding of the store's products, prices, and promotions.
* Stay updated on new arrivals, product features, and any changes in pricing or policies.
* Provide accurate and helpful information to customers regarding product availability and characteristics.

title: Counselor
description:
**Counselor**



Monday - Friday 5:15a -1:45p with possible Saturdays available


**Pinnacle’s Voice: A Tale of Transformation & Recovery**


**“I found myself like a lot of people in a position I never thought I would be in. I needed help bad… It all started with a call… one of the easiest and hardest things I’ve ever done. Every day I wake up and think how good it feels and how lucky I am to have found this place.”**


* **Patient, Pinnacle Treatment Centers**


**About Us:** Pinnacle Treatment Centers is a leading provider of comprehensive addiction treatment services, committed to transforming lives through compassionate care. Our approach is rooted in evidence-based practices, focusing on the holistic well-being of our patients, and treating our teammates with the same level of individualized compassion and empathy. We believe in providing a supportive and inclusive environment for both our patients and our dedicated team of professionals. Pinnacle transforms the lives of more than 35,000 individuals daily resulting in a network of care spanning across the country.


**Position Overview:** As a Counselor, you will play a crucial role in the recovery journey of our patients. Pinnacle’s unique approach combines compassionate care with innovative treatment methods to address the diverse needs of individuals seeking help for substance use disorders. Join us in making a positive impact on the lives of those we serve.


**Teammate Appreciation Benefits:** At Pinnacle Treatment Centers, we value our teammates and offer a variety of benefits to support their personal and professional growth.



* **Variable Pay Structure:** Competitive compensation based on experience, education, and licensure.


* **Defined Career Pathing:** Clear advancement opportunities through our Counselor Tier Program, designed to reward achievement in education, licensure, and credentials.


* **Bonus Incentives:** Recognizing and rewarding quality patient care with monthly performance-based bonuses.


* **STAR LRP Eligibility:** 90% of our facilities are eligible for the Student Loan Repayment Program. This federal program selects applicants to forgive 100% of their student loans.


* **Continuing Education:** Free access to over 600 CEU courses to enhance your skills and knowledge.


* **Paid Time Off:** 18 days of PTO and 8 paid holidays to maintain a healthy work-life balance.


* **Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Initiatives:** Be part of a workforce that reflects the diversity of our patient population.


* **Free Clinical Supervision:** Available based on licensure and availability to support your professional growth.



**Key Responsibilities:**


* Conduct individual and group counseling sessions using evidence-based practices.
* Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to develop and implement comprehensive treatment plans.
* Monitor and assess patient progress, adjusting interventions as needed.
* Contribute to the overall success of the treatment center through participation in team meetings and professional development activities.
* Develop the patient discharge/continuum of care plan to ensure movement to the appropriate levels of care.

**Manhattan, NY**  

  

At **New York Cancer & Blood Specialists** (NYCBS), we foster an environment where passionate professionals thrive. title: Director, NA Inventory Optimization Center of Excellence
description:
Coach is a global fashion house founded in New York in 1941. Inspired by the vision of Creative Director Stuart Vevers and the inclusive and courageous spirit of our hometown, we make beautiful things, crafted to last—for you to be yourself in.


Coach is part of the Tapestry portfolio – a global house of brands committed to stretching what’s possible.


A member of the Tapestry family, we are part of a global house of brands that has unwavering optimism and is committed to being innovative and wholly inclusive. Visit **Our People** page to learn more about Tapestry's commitment to equity, inclusion, and diversity.

  


**Title: Director, Inventory Optimization Center of Excellence**

  


**Primary Purpose:**


The Director is responsible for optimizing inventory levels to support Coach’s overall North America sales and inventory plans, ensuring inventory is in the right locations at the right time to meet the financial sales goals for both the Retail & Outlet Direct businesses (inclusive of stores & ecommerce). They will oversee Store Planning, Allocation & Optimization, focusing on optimizing inventory levels to meet sales plans and minimize lost sales without exceeding capacity constraints & Operations & Logistics, focusing on all operational needs related to ensure inventory is flowing as expected throughout the supply chain network and store fleet.

  


This position will report directly to the VP of Outlet Buying and Allocation, and is a pivotal partner to Buying, Finance, Brand Operations, Visual Merchandising, Fulfillment & Logistics, Field and Store Operations.

  

This is a great opportunity for an individual with outstanding communication, analytical and people management skills, who is strategic, motivated and systems-savvy, to take a hands-on role in driving Coach’s North America business.  

  

**The successful individual will…**


* Lead the Store Planning, Allocation & Optimization team (1 Senior Manager, 2 Analysts), responsible for:
* Optimizing inventory levels for the stores based on historical data & upcoming store sales plans by identifying potential risks (e.g., lost sales / out of stocks, stores over capacity, etc.) and defining solutions
* Being the expert with extensive knowledge of store, district, and regional level performance through detailed data analysis and use expertise to work with cross functional partners to support business growth
* Providing directions to category allocators where to pull back or push more based on demand, finance plans, capacity, safety stocks, etc.
* Developing and maintaining direct connection to the store field team on the inventory needs to help achieve their business goal
* Identifying unproductive inventory and recommend transfers back to FCs or store-to-store
* Managing overarching changes & communication to the allocation system (Allocate Smart) related to store level demand forecasting
* Overseeing ad hoc store analysis (e.g., A/B testing support and data as pricing, product, VM tests are run)
* Supporting pre-season planning by providing details on clustering changes and capacity needs at an overall store level
* Building strategic tiering plans to guide buying teams on assortment and stocking strategies based on customer & financial needs for each store ensuring they drive sales, gross margin & mitigate inventory risk
* Managing inventory positioning for E-commerce website
* Lead the Operations & Logistics team (1 Manager, 1 Analyst) to ensure the inventory needs are properly communicated to the Finance, Fulfillment & Logistics, Store & Ecommerce Operations Teams, including:
	+ Working closely with category allocators to determine weekly shipment plans (medium and short term)
	+ Partnering with Fulfillment & Logistics to plan and manage weekly/monthly shipments based on financial targets.
	+ Communicating to cross functional partners & field on product availability, transfers, consolidations and re-ticketing

**The accomplished individual will possess...**


* Minimum 10+ years of analytical experience, focus in retail allocation or store planning desired.
* People management experience required.
* Strong leadership skills and ability to support and motivate a high performing team.
* Strong strategic thinking and outstanding analytical/quantitative skills with ability to manage large amounts of data.
* Ability to effectively multi-task, prioritize and adapt to fast-paced, dynamic business environment.
* Excellent listening, communication and presentation skills; ability to effectively interact with team members and cross functional and field partners at all levels.
* Experience working with allocation systems required, experience with Impact Analytics solutions is a plus.
* Ability to learn systems and new processes quickly; advanced knowledge of Excel

**Our Competencies for All Employees**


* **Courage**: Doesn’t hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and “actionable” positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.
* **Creativity**: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
* **Customer Focus:** Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
* **Dealing with Ambiguity**: Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
* **Drive for Results:** Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
* **Interpersonal Savvy**: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.
* **Learning on the Fly:** Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.


**Our Competencies for All People Managers**


* **Strategic Agility**: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.
* **Developing Direct Reports and Others:** Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments; holds frequent development discussions; is aware of each person's career goals; constructs compelling development plans and executes them; pushes people to accept developmental moves; will take on those who need help and further development; cooperates with the developmental system in the organization; is a people builder.
* **Building Effective Teams**: Blends people into teams when needed; creates strong morale and spirit in their team; shares wins and successes; fosters open dialogue; lets people finish and be responsible for their work; defines success in terms of the whole team; creates a feeling of belonging in the team.

  




Coach is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and we pride ourselves on hiring and developing the best people. All employment decisions (including recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, transfer, training, discipline and termination) are based on the applicant’s or employee’s qualifications as they relate to the requirements of the position under consideration. These decisions are made without regard to age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic characteristics, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law.

  


**Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)**

Tapestry, Inc. will provide applicants and employees with reasonable accommodation for disabilities or religious beliefs. If you require reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please contact Tapestry People Services at 1-855-566-9264 or employeerelations@tapestry.com

  


Visit Coach at www.coach.com.

title: Sales Consultant
description:
**Audi Eatontown, a Penske Automotive Group dealership, is looking for Sales Associates to join our team and deliver extraordinary customer experiences.**


**JOIN OUR TEAM**  

Here at Penske Automotive Group (PAG), we strive to create a positive and inclusive workplace that promotes excellence and achievement, as we aim to deliver the very best experience possible to our customers. We are looking for dependable and committed professionals who share that same passion to join our sales team.



Come join our team and serve our communities essential transportation needs in a clean, friendly, and safe environment with a top automotive brand and a Fortune 500 company. We are seeking committed, passionate, and enthusiastic individuals with great a work ethic, the highest degree of integrity, and excellent customer and interpersonal skills to join our team and deliver a world class car buying experience to our valued clients. Our sales professionals can earn upwards of $100k per year and advancement opportunities are unlimited within the organization.


**WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER**


* Fortune 500 company, consistently recognized by Automotive News as among the "Best Dealerships to Work For."
* Proudly named to Glassdoor's Best Places to Work
* Competitive compensation with uncapped earning potential - our commission-based pay structure allows you to control your income.
* Comprehensive benefits program, including health care options (medical, dental and vision) and 401k savings and retirement plan with company match.
* Training, resources and opportunities for career growth and advancement, tailored to individual performance, experience and interests.
* Values-driven culture built on integrity, professionalism, excellence and teamwork.


**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**


* Genuine interest in providing an exceptional customer experience.
* Friendliness, enthusiasm, reliability, with a positive "team-player" attitude.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Strong work ethic with the ability to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.


**WHAT YOU CAN BRING TO THE TABLE**


* Commitment: Ensure our customers have a world-class car-buying experience at every step along their sales journey.
* Excellence: Provide an unparalleled level of knowledge, expertise, and authenticity to help customers find the vehicle they're looking for.
* Growth Mindset: Strive to grow the dealership and your career by hitting challenging monthly goals.
* Initiative: Bring new business to the dealership through referrals, networking and repeat business.
  


**APPLY WITH US!**



If you are ready for a rewarding career with competitive compensation and benefits, and opportunities to excel and advance, consider joining us on the Penske Automotive Group team. Our interview process typically includes a phone interview, several in-person interviews, background check, reference check, driving record review and a drug screen. Be a part of the best customer experience team in the automotive industry... apply with us today!



Penske Automotive Group is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a drug- and alcohol-free workplace. Some positions may require applicants to possess a valid driver's license and have a good driving record.

title: Buyer
description:
The Buyer/Planner is primarily responsible for indirect and direct material procurement, delivery, and confirmation of delivery and release to support the Master Product Schedule.

**General**:

* Maintain effectiveness of the Quality System components relevant to this position.
* Responsible for the supply of all materials to support production at Somerset facility.
* Identifies issues and resolves problems regarding materials. Supports problem resolution and communication to all affected internal customers (QA, Operations, Scheduling, Customer Service, and Finance).
* Leads investigations related to material discrepancies and Trackwise events.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Buying/Purchasing:**

* Generates and issues purchase orders (PO) to Suppliers within JDE in accordance with Approved Suppliers and ensures timely approval of PO’s with associated approval chain.
* Manage lead times and rush expenses with suppliers.
* Maintains tracker of Order status, PO Status, lead time, and receipt for all goods.
* Sources new suppliers, vendors, distributors as needed based on input from Formulations and **Operations**
* Ensures receipt of all documentation for materials (Specification, Instructions/Manual, COA, MSDS, BSE/TSE, GMO, EI as applicable)
* Monitors and adjusts open PO’s and supplier commitments. Resolves 3-way match issues to ensure timely supplier payment.
* Acquires quotes for materials as requested and specified by site team members.
* Collaborate with Global Procurement for high value purchases to ensure CDA, Code of Conduct, and Contract executed as applicable.
* Supports Capex Processes

**Planning:**

* Performs raw material planning for projects within JDE
* Maintains inventory levels consistent with site policies and goals. Quarterly adjusts safety stock levels in JDE based on self-analysis of inventory levels
* Maintains Item Masters, BOMs, routes and other associated supply chain data
* Supports launch activities as directed for new products.
* Review excess & obsolete inventory and provides supporting data to seek customer reimbursement for customer owned materials.
* Monitor inventory levels for raw materials to ensure site meets inventory targets. Adjust purchasing activities to support inventory management objectives.
* Processes material for destruction upon obsolescence or expiry.
* Processes materials for shipment including material samples and supports shipment documentation preparation.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $29.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift

Experience:

* purchasing: 3 years (Required)
* Procurement: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Somerset, NJ 08873 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Cashier Associate - Part-Time
description:
If you want an exciting job with one of the largest off-price retail stores in the nation, join the Burlington Stores, Inc. as a **Cashier** ! Are you a people person with an outgoing and friendly demeanor? Can you think on your feet in a fast-paced and demanding environment? Do you enjoy the satisfaction of positively impacting someone's day? If so, this may be the right role for you!


Cashiers are the heart of Burlington's success! As the last person our customers interact with in stores, you're tasked with the great responsibility of creating a lasting and positive memory of their Burlington shopping experience. By always maintaining a positive and professional attitude, and working to deliver excellent customer service that addresses all the customer's needs while getting them through the check-out process quickly and easily, our cashiers are key in helping us provide a world-class shopping experience to our customers.


**Responsibilities:**


* Deliver excellent customer service with a positive, professional attitude
* Accurately and efficiently ring on register
* Process layaways, returns, and exchanges
* Perform other tasks as assigned by manager from time-to-time

Candidates must be able to work a flexible schedule; including nights, weekends, and holidays as required.


**If you...**


... are excited to deliver great values to customers every day;


... take a sense of pride and ownership in helping drive positive results for a team;


... are committed to treating colleagues and customers with respect;


... believe in the power of diversity and inclusion;


... want to participate in initiatives that positively impact the world around you;


**Come join our team. You're going to like it here!**


You will enjoy a competitive wage, flexible hours, and an associate discount. Part-time associates, based on hours worked, may be eligible for Burlington's benefits package which includes dental and vision coverage, and including life insurance. Part-time associates may also be eligible for paid time off, paid holidays and a 401(k) plan.


We are a rapidly growing brand, and provide a variety of training and development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. Our store teams work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.

title: Box Office Staffer/Part-Time House Manager Substitute
description:
About New York Theatre Workshop:


At New York Theatre Workshop, we work relentlessly to empower visionary theatre‐makers and bring their work to adventurous audiences through productions, artist workshops and education and community engagement programs. We’re proud to be a home base for many of the most significant theatre‐makers of our time, nurturing groundbreaking writers like Nathan Alan Davis and Celine Song alongside powerhouse playwrights like Amy Herzog and Ayad Akhtar. From Rachel Chavkin and Lileana Blain‐Cruz to Whitney White and Rubén Polendo, we empower inimitable auteur‐directors and give invaluable support to tremendous talents in the earliest days of their careers. We’ve maintained decades‐long relationships with legendary theatre‐makers like Will Power, Ivo van Hove, Dael Orlandersmith, and Caryl Churchill, who have shaped our very understanding of what theatre can be.


Since our founding in 1979, we've produced over 150 fully‐realized productions including Jonathan Larson's Rent; Tony Kushner's Homebody/Kabul; Doug Wright's Quills; Claudia Shear's Dirty Blonde; Rick Elice’s Peter and the Starcatcher; Glen Hansard, Markéta Irglová and Enda Walsh’s Once; and David Bowie and Enda Walsh’s Lazarus. Enabling our artists to push boundaries generates work like Nathan Alan Davis’s Nat Turner in Jerusalem, Anaïs Michell’s Hadestown, Mfoniso Udofia’s Ufot Family Cycle, Heidi Schreck’s What the Constitution Means to Me, Jeremy O. Harris’s Slave Play, Kristina Wong's Kristina Wong, Sweatshop Overlord and Moisés Kaufman and Amanda Gronich’s Here There Are Blueberries. NYTW productions have received a Pulitzer Prize, 25 Tony Awards, 2 Grammy Awards and numerous Obie, Drama Desk and Lucille Lortel Awards.


But that’s not what we’re proudest of. We take the greatest satisfaction from the community we’ve built, and the perspective‐shifting experiences we’ve delivered along the way. We think that theatre can bring people together, change the conversation, and have a profound impact. We feel fortunate to get to support it. If that sounds like something you’re interested in, we’d love to meet you.


About the Team:


The Box Office Staff is the friendly face of New York Theatre Workshop, serving customers through phone and in-person sales and shaping the customer experience for everyone attending productions in its East Village theatre.


The Front of House staff is the friendly face of New York Theatre Workshop, shaping the customer experience for everyone attending productions in our East Village home. The House Managers lead this team during performances demonstrating the highest level of customer service and embodying the spirit of New York Theatre Workshop.


About the Position:

* Primarily serves as a Box Office Staffer, but subs in as a House Manager as needed for the Full-time and Part-Time regular House Managers


Box Office duties:

* Processes ticket and membership orders for phone sales and in-person transactions at the box office.
* Responsible for maintaining balanced cash drawer count, log and deposit tickets
* Provides support for customers purchasing online, resetting passwords, talking them through the buying process and taking over orders through the online portal as well as answering emails and phone calls for concierge assistance as needed.
* Prepares tickets for performances, managing pre-show box office pick up and maintaining a calm, friendly and organized pre-show experience for all customers.
* Executes post-performance reports for the house manager and financial reports for the finance team.
* Supports House Manager in ensuring the comfort and safety of audiences before, during and after performances.
* Assists in the onboarding and training of new team members
* Works on special projects as needed; including member booking, renewal and cancellation calls, Spektrix clean-up projects, inventory
* Participates in annual training and workshops and utilizes resources to stay abreast of changes and updates to policies, processes and procedures
* Maintains a working knowledge and interest in NYTW’s productions, memberships and special events.


House Manager duties:

* Responsible for overseeing front-of-house operations during performances for all major productions in NYTW’s intimate 199-seat theatre.
* Closely observes nightly operations to anticipate and solve problems before they develop
* Supports the box office staff with inventory management, front-of-house traffic flow and last-minute sales
* Maintains nightly reports and log books
* Secures the building at the close of every shift
* Ensures the safety and comfort of all patrons, actors and theatre staff through knowledge and execution of procedures and protocols
* Maintains a working knowledge and interest in NYTW’s productions, memberships and special events
* For each production, draft the SOP for HM/BO/FOH responsibilities, announcements, etc.
* Assists in the onboarding and training of new team members
* Works on special projects as needed; including member booking, renewal and cancellation calls, Spektrix clean-up projects, inventory, etc and provides support for special events as needed; including member/donor gatherings, benefits, gala, readings etc
* Participates in annual training and workshops and utilizes resources to stay abreast of changes and updates to policies, processes and procedures


Physical Requirements of the Positions:

* Ability to ascend an emergency ladder
* Capability to lift and carry items weighing between 35-45 lbs.
* Assist patrons during emergency situations as needed.
* Climb 1-2 flights of stairs
* Operate a roll down security gate at the start and end of shifts.
* Stand for periods of 1-2 hours and/or move between the lobby and theatre.
* Sit on a high stool for durations of 2-3 hours.


We comply with all applicable laws. If you require any accommodation(s) to perform the essential functions of this role please contact humanresources@nytw.org.

  

About You:

* You exhibit the highest level of professionalism, maintaining a calm demeanor under pressure while working efficiently and independently
* You have outstanding patience, customer service and phone demeanor.
* You work effectively as both a team player and a team leader
* You exemplify superb attention to detail and demonstrate confidence in problem-solving
* You are committed to an equitable and inclusive community.
* You communicate in a clear, professional manner and have outstanding patience and customer service skills.
* You have great interpersonal skills and the temperament for conflict resolution and de-escalation.
* You possess a passion for theatre and understanding of the industry


Bonus:

* Experience in House Management is strongly preferred.
* Certificate of Fitness for Indoor Place of Assembly Safety Personnel (F-03) and Certificate of Fitness for Supervision of Fire Alarm Systems (S-95) strongly preferred.
* You have previous box office experience
* You have Spektrix ticketing software experience

  

This is a part-time seasonal position requiring evening, weekend, and holiday hours with compensation at $20/hour for Box Office shifts and $23/hour for House Management shifts an average of 2-3 shifts/week while we are in performance. Work averages 12-16 hours per week across two-three shifts.

  

We know there are great candidates that may not have all of the qualifications listed above but possess intuitive knowledge or other fully transferable skills. So, don't hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself if that’s you.


NYTW has several affinity spaces as well as a Core Team of staff members across the organization committed to moving specific initiatives forward in our focus on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging and Accessibility (DEIBA).


NYTW is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We are committed to diversity in all areas of our work, on and offstage. We encourage applicants with a unique cultural perspective inclusive of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, class, physical ability, and sexual orientation.

title: Retail Inventory Management - Temp
description:
**Overview:**


Marc Jacobs International, powered by the creative genius of Marc Jacobs, seeks a **Retail Inventory Management Temp** to join the **Retail team** based in its New York City (SoHo) headquarters.  

  

This position is responsible for maintaining an accurate flow of inventory within the Marc Jacobs North America Retail & Outlet divisions. This includes daily reporting, cycle counting, shipment discrepancy research, merchandise returns, quality control issues, physical inventory management and analyzing inventory metrics

**RESPONSIBILITIES****:**

* Maintain inventory in compliance with company policies, ensuring accuracy and detailed recording of all inventory transactions.
* Conduct detailed research and analyze inventory discrepancies to identify trends leading to loss or shrinkage
* Develop and implement inventory control best practices while continuous monitoring and collaborating with logistics and warehouse teams.
* Support the execution and reconciliation of cycle counts, including proposing internal controls and monitoring procedures.
* Supervise inter-store/location transfers to ensure accurate processing from initiation to completion.
* Manage the Special Order process in collaboration with cross-functional partners.
* Monitor Cegid (POS) reporting to ensure accurate recording of On-Hand and In-Transit inventory units.
* Reconcile In-Transit and Offsite inventory discrepancies, contributing to the development of improved inventory control procedures.
* Manage physical inventory counts as well as cycle counts to ensure compliance with internal inventory controls.
* Clean up of any outstanding system issues in Cegid

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Prior experience in inventory management, preferably in a retail or logistics environment.
* Proficiency in Cegid Management Software or similar POS experience
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
* Strong understanding of inventory control practices and procedures.
* Excellent analytical skills and problem solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

**SALARY & BENEFITS/WHAT WE OFFER:**


The compensation for this position ranges from **$35-$42** (hourly). The rate of pay offered will be dependent upon candidate’s relevant skills and experience. MJ employees also receive discounts on MJ products throughout the year.

**ABOUT MARC JACOBS**


For nearly 40 years, Marc Jacobs has been a driving force in fashion with his philosophy: pioneering designs, an irreverent spirit, the everyday and the extraordinary. Today, the brand continues to make its Marc as rebellious, unpredictable, and original.


Our work is founded on our core brand pillars: unexpected, utilitarian, urban, unisex, and unique. NYC in design and spirit, our teams thrive off relentless authenticity, an openness to standing out, and inclusivity for all.

**EEO STATEMENT**


Marc Jacobs International was founded on Marc’s vision of celebrating uniqueness and being Perfect as You Are. We are committed to building an equitable and inclusive culture that values diversity of thought, background, and experience – all essential to our spirit of innovation and creativity. In line with this commitment, we believe that the best candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background or may meet the qualifications in different ways. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the listed qualifications.


Marc Jacobs International is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, national origin, religion, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Care Manager-BOOM!Health
description:
**Job Title:** Case/Care Manager - BOOM!Health

**Job Summary:**

As a Case/Care Manager your function is to act as a leader in providing appropriate care management services to approximately 50 active clients according to the guidelines set out in the ACCESS Program Manual (and as required by the NYSDOH – HH, AIDS Institute).

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

* Be familiar with the ACCESS Program Manual (with particular attention to the specific functions of the Care Manager 1 position). This manual was created in accordance with procedures based upon AIDS institute NYSDOH and Health Home guidelines
* Complete an in-depth screening, intake, and initial assessment; subsequently completing and overseeing a client-focused care plan, detailed and mutually developed with each participant
* Implementation of the care plan with documented follow-up and monitoring of the plan
* Advocacy and knowledge of available and appropriate services for participants and their families/collaterals
* Conduct home visits as required and as needed (with a minimum of one home visit per care plan period)
* Conduct regular case conferences with outside providers on an as-need basis (NOTE: Care Manager 1 must ensure that at least one case conference is conducted at least once per service plan period for every client).
* Being available for crisis intervention, having to remain with a client until the issue is resolved or addressed
* Complete accurate and up to date documentation and consents for services Conduct daily follow ups to address any issues, review the previous day's activities, and to discuss any client issues and/or new insights regarding a particular client
* Be knowledgeable and up-to-date in areas pertaining to HIV / AIDS symptoms and medications, also other chronic illnesses.
* Be able to work in and create a positive environment, manage providers, delegate and oversee tasks/duties, and address conflicts as they arise.
* Communicate effectively with supervisory personnel in a cooperative and supportive manner.
* Maintain monthly per member per month billing standards, meeting one of the 5 core Health Home functions.
* Complete HCBS Waiver Form if they do not meet the criteria to provide HCBS services
* Complete the New York State Eligibility Assessment for clients who are deemed eligible for HCBS services. If a client is found eligible for HCBS services, Health Home Care Managers must complete the New York State Community Mental Health Assessment (CMHA).
* Create an individual-centered plan of care that integrates behavioral and physical health services and includes HCBS for clients who are found eligible.
* Coordinate with a client’s Managed Care Organization (MCO’s) in order to ensure a client receives the HCBS service(s) they are eligible for.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of one year of direct case management experience\\*
* Knowledge of HIV / AIDS transmission and treatment and other chronic illnesses
* Meets physical and cognitive requirements needed to complete assigned tasks and duties of the position with reasonable accommodations being made for individuals with disabilities
* Ability to travel within the five boroughs of New York City via public transportation
* Ability to demonstrate proper judgment and decision-making skills when necessary
* Excellent written, verbal, and organizational skills
* Ability to manage time effectively
* Knowledge of computers/word processing a plus

\\*Direct Care Management experience includes verifiable full/part-time care management or case work with the following populations: those with HIV/AIDS, or a history of mental illness, homelessness, or chemical dependence.

Experience with families or groups preferred; experience with HRA, HASA, hospitals or clinics a plus. Qualifying experience does not include activities or job positions such as pastoral counseling, counseling, therapeutic activities, internships or any unpaid/volunteer positions.

**Education:**

* A bachelor’s degree in any of the following: child & family studies, community mental health, counseling, education, nursing, occupational therapy, physical therapy, psychology, recreation, recreational therapy, rehabilitation, social work, sociology, or speech and hearing; OR NYS licensure and current registration as a Registered Nurse and a bachelor’s degree;
* OR a Bachelor’s level education or higher in any field with five years of experience working directly with persons with behavioral health diagnoses; OR a Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC).

Please visit our website for information: www.arguscommunity.org

NYC law prohibits us from requiring you to share information about your current or past salary. Although we may discuss salary expectations with you, you should not interpret any of our questions as seeking or requiring information about your current or past salary.

We are a Drug-Free Workplace. All candidates are subject to a drug test.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Case management: 3 years (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Bronx, NY 10451 (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Patient Service Coordinator
description:
**Patient Service Coordinator**

**Who is LIVS…**

Long Island Veterinary Specialists (LIVS) is a well-established, AAHA-certified, specialty-emergency hospital that has been serving the Long Island and metropolitan community for over 25 years. We have a staff of over 160 fun and enthusiastic professionals supporting of our mission, *Pro Bono Animalium Hominumque*… ”For the good of animals and humans”. With this mission in mind, it is our goal to create a caring, progressive, and fun environment where our staff can flourish and focus on our furry friends in need. We provide specialty services in a variety of disciplines. Although we have industry-leading, advanced diagnostic equipment, it is our team of diverse, caring, and dedicated support staff for which we are most proud and grateful.

**Who we seek…**

We are seeking friendly, enthusiastic, Patient Care Coordinators who enjoy problem-solving and have an innate calling to care for animals, their families, and fellow teammates. Best candidates should possess the following traits:

* Enjoys working with animals
* Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
* Likes to solve problems & prioritize
* Strong interpersonal & communication skills
* Meticulous to detail & organized
* Professional & reliable

This position coordinates highly personalized client and patient services. This person will establish a professional relationship with their assigned clients. They will provide support, information, and patient updates, while assuring clients that LIVS provides the highest level of medical care. Responsibilities include auditing invoices, handling medication refill requests, patient admissions and discharges, and other aspects of client and patient services.

**What we offer…**

* Health insurance
* 401K w/company match
* 2 weeks of paid vacation time
* 7 days of sick/personal time
* Hands-on training program and mentorship
* Strong support
* Discounted care for our team’s pets
* A flexible combination of weekday and weekend shifts.
* Growth & education opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* AD&D insurance
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Parental leave
* Prescription drug insurance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Every weekend
* Holidays

Work Location: In person
