title: Part Time floating Assistant Manager- ($20-$22hr) Retail/Storage NY34/NY27
description:
Company Overview:

Prime Group Holdings is one of the fastest growing private equity real estate firms in the country. We are focused on acquiring and adding value to a growing portfolio of real estate assets located throughout the United States. Our team members are:

* Customer and client focused.
* Self-motivated entrepreneurs who are passionate about what they do.
* Diligent ethical professionals dedicated to creating long-term value for our stakeholders.
* Eager to make a positive difference in the lives of their customers and clients.

Position Overview:

As the Assistant Manager with Prime Storage Group, you will be responsible for assisting in the day-to-day operation of one or more self-storage facilities, including renting units, selling merchandise, interacting with customers, and maintaining the property overall. Our employees are the first line representatives to the customer. The Assistant Manager must have the ability to work face-to-face with customers and build excellent relationships while enhancing your customer service and sales skills and experience.

Job Responsibilities:

* Renting self-storage units, parking space, and other related products.
* Converting telephone and walk-in inquiries into rentals.
* Maintain Account Receivables through the pursuit of collections, posting of payments and processing, and delivery of daily bank deposits accurately and timely.
* Upsell moving products and assist in unit sizing decisions.
* Greeting customers promptly, enthusiastically and professionally.
* Knowing and presenting the features and benefits of the property at all opportunities.
* Resolve customer issues in a timely and effective manner.
* Ensures that company standards of cleanliness and appearance are met.
* Inspect the property, including performing lock checks, keeping the property esthetically pleasing and maintaining interior cleanliness including bathrooms.
* Showing customers our self-storage units.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Getting the units “guest ready” for the next person when a customer moves out.

Job Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* A self-starter in all respects
* A passionate desire for career advancement
* 1-2 years of relevant work experience in a fast-paced, customer-facing environment.
* Retail/Sales experience.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – both on the phone and in person
* A person who works well independently and in a team setting.
* Have a working knowledge of computer applications (Microsoft Office, Outlook, etc.)
* Possess a valid driver's license and insurance with access to reliable transportation.
* Have the ability and willingness to perform light maintenance such as sweeping, mopping, wiping, lifting (up to 50lbs), operate handheld tools etc.
* Be capable and willing to travel to work in multiple locations in the area as needed.

What Prime Offers:

* A healthy work/life balance; most of our facilities are closed by 6:00 pm and are not open on Sundays.
* Competitive pay and bonus plan
* Health, dental, life, vision, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance
* A 401(k) program with a company “matching” policy
* Paid time off and paid holidays
* Career advancement opportunities

For more information, please visit our website: https://primestorage.com/home-storage

Internal applicants: please reach out to your DM and apply internally.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER STATEMENT

Prime Group Holdings is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you have weekend availability?
* Can you work at other locations in the district when needed?

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Product Manager- RevOp- Metro
description:
Product Manager- RevOp- Metro

  

Aug 29, 2024


New York, NY


Summary

Chobani is seeking an experienced Product Manager to lead the strategic vision and execution of our Revenue Optimization (RevOp) tool. This pivotal role drives product initiatives that optimize media spend and enhance revenue decisions across the company's trade and promotional strategies. The successful candidate will bridge the gap between data science innovations and business applications, ensuring that our product solutions are not only data-driven but also user-centric and commercially viable.



Responsibilities
* Product Strategy and Vision: Develop and articulate the product vision and strategy for Chobani's RevOp tool, aligning with the company’s broader business goals and market opportunities
* Product Lifecycle Management: Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of the product from ideation, prototyping, and validation to launch and post-launch enhancements. Ensure the product meets the market needs and exceeds user expectations
* Cross-Functional Leadership: Work closely with engineering, data science, marketing, sales, and finance teams to ensure successful product development, launch, and adoption. Facilitate seamless communication and collaboration across departments
* Market and User Research: Conduct thorough market research and user feedback sessions to understand the needs and pain points of both internal stakeholders and external customers. Translate these insights into product features and improvements
* Performance Metrics and ROI Analysis: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for the product and track these metrics to evaluate the product’s impact on business goals, particularly focusing on ROI and revenue growth
* Team Building and Leadership: Hire, mentor, and lead a team of product managers and related staff, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence within the team
* Stakeholder Management: Engage with senior executives to gather support and alignment for product initiatives. Present product roadmaps and performance reports to executive teams and key stakeholders
Requirements
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in product management, preferably with a focus on software or analytics products in the CPG or retail sectors
* Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills combined with a strong business acumen
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
* Experience working with data science teams and familiarity with machine learning concepts is highly desirable
* Demonstrable ability to lead and inspire a team in a fast-paced environment
About Us

Chobani is a food maker with a mission of making high-quality and nutritious food accessible to more people, while elevating our communities and making the world a healthier place. In short: making good food for all. In support of this mission, Chobani is a purpose-driven, people-first, food-and-wellness-focused company, and has been since its founding in 2005 by Hamdi Ulukaya, an immigrant to the U.S. The Company manufactures yogurt, oat milk, and creamers – Chobani yogurt is America's No.1 yogurt brand, made with natural ingredients without artificial preservatives. Following the 2023 acquisition of La Colombe, a leading coffee roaster with a shared commitment to quality, craftmanship and impact, the Company began selling cold-pressed espresso and lattes on tap at 32 cafes, as well as Ready to Drink (RTD) coffee beverages at retail.


Chobani uses food as a force for good in the world – putting humanity first in everything it does. The company’s philanthropic efforts prioritize giving back to its communities and beyond: working to eradicate child hunger, supporting immigrants, refugees and underrepresented people, honoring veterans, and protecting the planet. Chobani manufactures its products in New York, Idaho, Michigan and Australia, and its products are available throughout North America and distributed in Australia and other select markets.


For more information, please visit www.chobani.com and www.lacolombe.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.


*Chobani is an equal opportunity employer. Chobani will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on any basis including, but not limited to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military and/or veteran status, marital status, predisposing genetic characteristics and genetic information, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws.*



Compensation Range: $120,000.00 - $180,000.00, plus bonus.
company_description: This evolution supports Chobani’s ambition to become a food-focused wellness company and providing better food to all people.

title: Support Professional For Autism - East Hanover
description:
Are you currently working in a role within Human Services or Social Services, providing crucial support to others? Consider directing your passion and expertise toward a fulfilling career in the Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) field. Your valuable skills and commitment to enhancing lives can make a significant impact on children with Autism, aligning with a community dedicated to positive change.


**Perks:**


* Enjoy job security and advancement opportunities in the thriving ABA industry.
* Experience flexible schedules that accommodate your current commitments within the realm of Human Services or Social Services.
* Receive competitive compensation, recognizing and valuing your contributions.
* Ideal for those seeking part-time roles.
* Tailored for professionals with a background in providing compassionate care and support.
* No prior experience needed; we provide comprehensive training!

**Responsibilities:**


* Provide one-on-one ABA services to clients, using evidence-based interventions supporting independence and positive behavior.
* Serve as an integral member of our clinical team, responsible for the direct implementation of skill-building and care plans.
* Record session data accurately using electronic devices.
* Foster a positive learning environment for clients and connect with families.

**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Willingness to learn and passionate about making a difference for children with Autism.
* Patience, compassion, and the ability to maintain a calm demeanor in challenging situations.

**Need to Know:**


* Services will be provided in clients' homes or in community-based locations.
* All positions start off part-time.
* Required to take the 40-hour Registered Behavior Technician course.
* Looking to hire candidates who are willing to make a 6-month commitment to change our clients lives.

If you have considered any of the helping professions like Home Health Aide (HHA), Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA), Personal Care Assistant (PCA), Case Manager, Rehab Counselor, Mental Health Counselor, or Direct Support Professional (DSP) this may be a great new field for you to explore.


Ready to channel your support skills into a purpose-driven career? Apply today, join our team, and let your passion positively impact the lives of children with Autism.

title: Retail Cashier
description:
Founded in Italy in 2007, Eataly is the world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace. At Eataly, you can *Eat* a meal at restaurants or quick-service counters, *Shop* for the ingredients, and *Learn* through classes and tastings. Eat Better, Live Better! Eataly is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**JOB OVERVIEW**

A Front End Sales Associate/Cashier handles payments and ensures accurate accounting of all transactions, collections and disbursements.

Reports to the Market Manager and Assistant Marketing Managers.

· Collects cash, checks or charge payments from guests and provides change and charge vouchers if appropriate

· Verifies accuracy of cash bank by counting cash, checks and charge payments at end of shift

· Obtains and reviews information regarding price changes

· Verifies employee discounts, returns, exchanges and voids with the assistance of the manager or shift lead

· Returns carts and baskets to their central distribution areas, takes back go-backs/damages, fixes displays, helps restock, and supports team members

title: Bilingual Client Services Representative
description:
**Who We Are :**

At Neuropath Healthcare Solutions, we provide comprehensive technology-driven healthcare solutions for healthcare organizations, including hospitals, long-term care, outpatient facilities, and residential treatment. We are focused on acquiring the best talent. We want our Client Services Representative to be internally motivated and adaptive. We value our fast-paced team dynamic and are looking for individuals who embody our core values as a client-focused organization.

**Job Summary:**

Our Client Services Representative will provide program coordination along with performing administrative functions for our clientele. They interact with Neuropath Healthcare Solutions clients by ensuring they receive the services they need and resolving any complaints. In addition, the ideal candidate should be comfortable speaking to customers, multitask efficiently, be organized, flexible and driven.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Interacts with clients via telephone or email, to provide support and information on products or services.
* Collects and enters requests for new or additional services.
* Case assignments & Service Scheduling
* Fields client inquiries and complaints; when the issue is beyond the representative’s knowledge, forwards to the assigned specialist or other appropriate staff.
* Performs client satisfaction calls.
* Ensures that appropriate actions are taken to resolve clients’ problems and concerns.
* Maintains client accounts and records of client interactions with details of inquiries, complaints, or comments.
* Attends in-service training as required by regulation.
* Adheres to all agency administrative and clinical policies and procedures.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Requirements**

* Must be Bilingual in Spanish, Portuguese, or Creole
* At least a year of relevant experience
* Bachelor's degree required
* Salary starts at $18 per hour
* Must have experience in an office setting

**Skills/Abilities:**

* Excellent communication skills including active listening
* Service-oriented and able to resolve customer grievances
* Proficient computer skills with the ability to learn new software
* Being Bilingual (Spanish Speaking) is a plus

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree is required with at least one year of relevant experience
* Office operations experience is required
* Customer service experience is required

**This is NOT an entry-level position, relevant experience is required when applying.** 

**We are open to referrals, please inquire about when speaking with your recruiter**  **\\*This position is temp to hire. After successful completion of 90 days of employment, an offer for full-time employment will be extended.\\***

title: Business Analyst - Payments and Securities Messaging - New York
description:
**Business Analyst – Payments and Securities Messaging**

**Location: New York**


**Fixed Term Contract**

  

This is a fantastic opportunity to join our fast-growing Consulting Business working with some of the world's leading financial institutions.  



  

As a Business Analyst, the successful candidate will work directly with our Tier 1 clients to ensure they receive the quality consulting services that Delta Capita offers. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of financial services, exceptional problem-solving skills, business analysis and project management experience specifically within financial service messaging Additionally, they will have the ability to manage, motivate and inspire others, with a proven track record of delivering successful client engagements. They will have deep change management experience and prior success as a management consultant or within a change role in a financial services institution. They will have extensive experience with SWIFT messaging formats across various products and a good understanding of ISO 20022.  



  

To learn more about our Consulting services, click here Consulting – Delta Capita.  



  

**Key Responsibilities**


* Work alongside our client to support their payments and securities messaging uplift efforts
* Conduct analysis of current and future state and collaborate with various delivery teams to design strategic solutions for delivery of a cross-product platform for SWIFT message processing
* Ensure that proposed solutions align with the organization’s strategic goals and technological capabilities
* Ensure all agreed outputs and decisions are suitably well documented in the agreed tools, throughout the requirements lifecycle, from initial capture through various stages of refinement and through to testing and implementation

 **Required Experience & Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
* 2-4 years of relevant experience
* Extensive experience with SWIFT and other payments formats across various products and understanding of ISO 20022 Payments and Securities messaging
* Demonstrable experience around messaging implementations
* Strong communication and presentation skills
* Exceptional attention to detail
* Ability to build and maintain excellent relationships with business stakeholders and gain their trust in order to guide them

 **Expectations Regarding Hybrid Working:**

As we are a Service Provider and Consulting firm servicing clients, our policy on physically working from the office (which may be the client’s offices or our own offices depending on the client) aligns to what our client’s policies and expectations are, and these vary. Most of our clients now require a minimum of 3 days per week in the office, 2 days from home, and accordingly, this is also the minimum expectation that Delta Capita requires. However, some of our clients have now moved up to 4 or even 5 days in the office and we require candidates to be flexible to meet our clients’ demands. For this role, the client typically requires 4-5 days in the office.

 **Salary Range: $75,000-$95,000**

 **How We Work:**



Delta Capita is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require any reasonable adjustments through your interview process, please use the designated space within the application questionnaire.

  

As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible. If your profile is selected, a member of our team will contact you. For this role a valid work authorization for the US is mandatory.

 **Who We Are:**

Delta Capita Group (a member of the Prytek Group) is a global managed services, consulting and solutions provider with a unique combination of experience in Financial Services and technology innovation capability. Our mission is to reinvent the financial services value chain providing technology based mutualized services for financial institutions for non-differentiating services.


* Managed Services
* Resource Augmentation
* Consulting
* Technology



To learn more about Delta Capita and our culture click here: Working at DC - Delta Capita.

title: Human Resources Coordinator
description:
**HR Coordinator**

 **Location:** Remote

 **Job Summary:**



Curv Group is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive HR Coordinator to support our Human Resources team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in maintaining HR processes, managing employee records, assisting in recruitment, and enhancing employee relations. This position requires excellent communication skills, strong organizational abilities, and a passion for fostering a positive workplace culture.

 **Key Responsibilities:**


* **Recruitment and Onboarding:** Assist with recruitment activities, including job posting, resume screening, coordinating interviews, and supporting new hire onboarding processes.
* **Employee Records Management:** Maintain and update employee records and databases, ensuring data accuracy and confidentiality.
* **Payroll and Benefits Administration:** Manage payroll processes and assist with benefits administration, including enrollments, changes, and inquiries.
* **Employee Support:** Address employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance and resolving issues in a timely and professional manner.
* **Event Coordination:** Organize and coordinate employee events and initiatives to promote engagement and a positive work environment.
* **Policy Development:** Assist in the development, communication, and implementation of HR policies and procedures.
* **Employee Relations:** Manage employee relations by addressing concerns, mediating conflicts, and fostering a positive workplace culture.
* **Attendance and Leave Management:** Administer and track employee time-off requests and attendance records, ensuring compliance with company policies.
* **Documentation Management:** Oversee HR documentation, including employment contracts, policy manuals, and other related documents.
* **HR Systems Management:** Manage HR-related software systems, ensuring data accuracy and resolving system-related issues.
* **Expense and Budget Tracking:** Monitor HR-related expenses and assist in managing departmental budgets to ensure cost-effective operations.

 **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Proven experience in an HR support role, preferably as an HR Coordinator or HR Assistant.
* Familiarity with HR software and databases (e.g., HRIS, ATS).
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Knowledge of employment laws and regulations.
* High level of discretion and confidentiality.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

 **Benefits:**


* Competitive salary in USD
* 100% remote
* Paid time off
* Professional development and training opportunities
* A collaborative and inclusive work environment

description:
Manhattan Gastroenterology is looking for a Patient Concierge/ Care Coordinator to join our team. We are looking for someone who is dependable, likes taking on challenges, and meets deadlines.

title: Associate Visuals Director
description:
The foundation of Vogue’s leadership and authority is the brand’s unique role as a cultural barometer for a global audience. Vogue places fashion in the context of culture and the world we live in — how we dress, live and socialize; what we eat, listen to and watch; who leads and inspires us. Vogue immerses itself in fashion, always leading readers to what will happen next. Thought-provoking, relevant and always influential, Vogue defines the culture of fashion.
Job Description
Location:
New York, NY
Vogue is looking for an Associate Visuals Director to manage cross-platform photo production and visual research. This is a hands-on role responsible for producing innovative, multi-channel, multi-market work that meets brand integrity and production quality standards, while remaining on schedule and on budget. Reporting to the Global Visuals Director, the ideal candidate will be experienced with a growing book of contacts for agencies, photographers, stylists, and studios; strong editorial judgment and taste; and a highly focused work style to manage multiple projects, priorities and deadlines at once.
Primary Responsibilities:* Pitch cross-platform ideas to the Global Creative Director and Global Visuals Director that contribute to the visual strategy.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with editors in order to understand visual/photo needs and orchestrate projects accordingly.
* Regularly review portfolios and proactively build relationships with agencies and photographers to unearth new talent.
* Under the direction of the Global Visuals Director, the Associate Visuals Director collaborate on cross-platform photo shoot production, ensuring the creative concept is upheld from brief to final delivery, including:
	+ Creating visual mood boards
	+ Commissioning teams and liaising with agents, photographers, studios, stylists, hair/makeup, catering, and other vendors throughout the project
	+ Creating and maintaining timelines, schedules, budgets, shot-lists, call-sheets, and other production documents - proactively sharing and communicating this information to all key stakeholders throughout the project
	+ Attending and managing on-set production, as needed
	+ Partnering with video colleagues to ensure appropriate synergy across photo and video production
	+ Coordinating the post-production process for lo-res and hi-res photo selection and final delivery
* Contribute to tracking and maintaining the overall photo budget, including setting and assigning individual project budgets to team members, ensuring efficient use of all budget resources, and communicating effectively to the Global Creative Director and Operations/Finance partners on all active projects.
* Manage the team to ensure all invoices are tracked and processed in a timely manner and that jobs are wrapped accurately and efficiently.
* Develop, implement, and maintain clear processes and communication channels for the team, helping people do their jobs more easily and ensuring work is happening in sync.
* Manage a team of Visuals Editors providing clear direction and constructive feedback. Helping to manage their workload and ensure key deadlines are met.
* Nurture talent and foster a transparent, respectful, inclusive, and collaborative team environment.
* Contribute effectively to all HR/People processes such as performance management, recruitment, etc.

  

Requirements:* 5+ years work experience in the visual production industry, with a growing book of contacts for agencies, photographers, stylists, studios, etc.
* Strong editorial judgment with demonstrated experience developing visual stories across platforms, using detailed understanding of platform requirements.
* A highly motivated self-starter with proven ability to manage multiple projects, priorities, and deadlines in a fast-paced, matrixed environment.
* A meticulous eye for detail and impeccable organizational skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to navigate multiple stakeholders’ inputs, opinions, and decision-making styles.
* People management experience with a track record of inspiring and fostering developing talent.
* A work-style that balances entrepreneurial spirit with operational rigor.
* Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion, diplomacy, and tact.
* Experience in and passion for fashion, culture, and lifestyle photography and illustration.
* Ability to travel on occasion for assignments and shoots


The expected base salary range for this position is from $110,000-$120,000. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including but not limited to relevant skills, training, experience, and education.
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.*Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.*

title: Chess Instructor - Westchester Co. NY
description:
**About the NSCF**

Established in 1990, the National Scholastic Chess Foundation (NSCF) is a non-profit organization committed to providing comprehensive chess education. We are a proven provider led by FM Sunil Weeramantry, one of the most successful chess coaches in US history.

Our mission is to teach critical thinking, problem-solving and life skills. With a focus on integrating chess into scholastic education, we provide instructional resources and teacher training that align with state standards and social-emotional learning competencies. By joining the NSCF team, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside other passionate individuals dedicated to providing high-quality chess instruction and playing opportunities that positively impact our students and their communities.

**Job Description**

We are seeking dedicated teachers to bring the benefits of chess education to diverse communities. As a chess teacher with the NSCF, you will engage with student groups, nurturing a positive and inclusive learning environment. If you have a passion for working with children and a love for chess, you could be an excellent fit for our team.

Pay range: $65-80 per class; flexible schedule.

**Responsibilities**

· Prepare and deliver fun, engaging chess lessons.

· Adapt teaching methods to accommodate diverse student groups and skill levels.

· Ensure the safety and supervision of students at all times.

· Maintain open communication with NSCF staff.

· Provide or obtain a background check as required.

· Arrive at least 10 minutes early for each class.

· Stay after class until all children are picked up.

**Qualifications/Requirements**

· REQUIRED: At least 5 years of chess playing experience. Ideal candidates will have some tournament experiences and a USCF rating of 1400+.

· Experience working with children, even if unrelated to chess (teacher, camp counsellor, etc.).

· Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

· Ability to inspire and motivate students.

· Must have reliable transportation.

**Why NSCF?**

· Be part of an organization that inspires academic excellence through chess and has a proven record of success for 40 years.

· Work alongside a team of experienced chess educators.

· Make a meaningful impact on students' lives, fostering critical thinking skills.

· Enjoy a flexible work schedule.

**To Apply**

To apply, submit your resume and a statement of interest. Include information about your chess background, teaching experience or experience working with children (even if unrelated to chess) and explain why you are interested in joining our team.

The NSCF is an equal opportunity employer. If you're passionate about bringing chess education to students in Westchester and Putnam Counties, NY, and Western CT, we'd love to welcome you as our next coach at the National Scholastic Chess Foundation!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $65.00 - $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 10 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* After school
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Do you have your own transportation?
* Do you have a USCF chess rating? If yes, please provide it. Otherwise, tell us about your chess experience.

Ability to Commute:

* Westchester County, NY (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Solar Sales Consultant
description:
**About Helios Energy Power:**

**Since 2018, Helios Energy Power has been one of the largest residential solar companies in California. We are looking for passionate, self-motivated sales leaders who have a desire to upstart their career and help homeowners go green, save money, and invest in increasing their home value, in most cases without spending a dime of their own money.**

**As a company, we want to be a powerful force for good in our employees' lives by creating a unique culture that impacts us in a positive way and empowers each of us to reach our full potential. We dream of a better future for our customers, our employees, and our planet, and we want you to be an integral part of that future!**

**Primary Responsibilities:**

**Helios Energy Power: Outside Sales Consultants will work closely with potential and current customers helping them through the process of converting from traditional dirty power usage to clean, cost-effective, solar energy. Outside Sales Consultants are vital in helping interested homeowners understand the importance of solar energy while proactively earning their business. They will own the sales process from acquisition to close and will be supported by the best operations and install teams in the business.**

* Educate homeowners on the positive effects of solar energy including energy cost savings, clean energy, and worthwhile investment to increase home value
* Market Helios Energy Power products and services and set up new customers
* Create opportunities by self generating leads and referrals by going DOOR TO DOOR. Supplement your work with company supplied leads and appointments.

Unfamiliar with the solar industry? We've got you covered:

* Solar in the US is booming!
* Nearly 250,000 Americans work in solar (more than double the number in 2012)
* The cost of solar has dropped by 70%; making it cheaper than electricity prices
* There are 1.6M total installs in the US currently, should hit 2M in 2019 and 4M by 2023
* California is a top 10 state for solar growth
* Owned solar systems in CA can add about 3.1% value to the home as per a 2019 Zillow study.

Requirements:

* Must attend and pass applicable sales training
* Be able to efficiently communicate proposals during in-home presentations+
* Laptop or iPad for presentations
* Reliable Transportation a must
* Attend Industry leading trainings and sales meetings on our products, techniques, and receive support from a heavily experienced management team
* Regularly cultivate new business by both cold calling customers and pursuing company leads
* Participate in team campaigns such as door to door, tables at events, some retail opportunities and presentations that reach crowds of homeowners

What you'll be provided:

* Leads will be provided as long as you meet our self gen requirement of (5)
* Get access to leading technology for Canvassing and Door Tracking
* You'll Also Receive access to premium finance products with the latest battery technology and leading Solar Modules on the Market
* Fast Installations
* CRM with a Commission Tracker

Compensation:

* 100% Commission
* Very aggressive compensation, Bonuses and incentives
* Weekly Commission Pay
* Uncapped commissions that are well above industry average
* Average full-time $90,000 - $150,000 yearly, with an upside of $250,000+

For More Information: Email Careers@Heliosenergypower.com

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Commission

Pay: $100,000.00 - $300,000.00 per year

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 12 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

* Morning shift
* Night shift

title: Sales Excellence – Bid Management Manager - H&PS
description:
**About Accenture:**


At Accenture, we believe your career is about what you want to be and who you want to be. It’s about bringing your skills, your curiosity, and your best true self to your work. Here, you’ll match your ingenuity with the latest technology to do incredible things. Together, we can create positive, long-lasting change.

**We Are:**


Sales Excellence. Sales Excellence at Accenture empowers our people to compete, win and grow. We develop everything they need to grow their client portfolios, optimize their deals and enable their sales talent, all driven by sales intelligence.

**You Are:**


A connector of dots as well as people. Like a mountain guide, you lead diverse teams towards a common goal with clear communication. You are a motivator. As the climb gets tough, you keep the group focused on the summit while you navigate obstacles along the way. You enjoy bringing talented people together and charting the path to shared success.

**The Work:**


As a Sales Excellence Manager, you manage deal teams throughout the entire bid lifecycle. You use your sales process knowledge to ensure the right resources are engaged in preparing, developing, and negotiating bids that meet and exceed client requirements.

**You will:**

* Understand clients’ needs and work with deal leadership to define win strategies and messaging
* Determine what expertise are needed to develop a compelling offer and plan resources accordingly
* Drive bid activities and facilitate communication across teams and workstreams
* Build and nurture positive relationship with key deal team stakeholders
* Seek opportunities to optimize the bid management process and tools
* Develop yourself and others through continuous learning and knowledge sharing

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 6 years of experience in bid management, sales or presales work.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree
* MBA
* Health Payer/Provider experience
* Public Service experience
* Experience with sales, sales enablement and negotiations fundamentals.
* Familiarity with concepts such as design thinking fundamentals, pipeline management, deal qualification, competitive positioning, client relationship strategy, relationship management techniques, deal shaping or financial modeling.
* Contract drafting management fundamentals.
* Understanding of basic concepts of outsourcing, business process services, or Cloud, Security or other Technology aspects, platforms, or current trends
* Experience working with professional services industry.
* Experience working on large, global, and complex multi-million-dollar opportunities containing multiple types of work.

**Professional Skills**

* Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian.
* Ability to work across multiple time zones

**Other requirements (please specify such as overtime, etc.)**

* Must support/mirror work hours for the supported Market Unit or other business area.
* Must be flexible with work hours according to business needs.
* Must have good internet connectivity and a distraction-free environment for working at home, in accordance with local guidelines.
* May be occasionally required to travel domestically or internationally.

**Additional Comments**

* Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.

*Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired* *in California**, Colorado, New York or Washington as set forth below.* *We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.*

*Information on benefits is here.*

*Role Location**Annual Salary Range*

*California**$93,400 to $196,500*

*Colorado**$93,400 to $169,800*

*District of Columbia**$99,500 to $180,800*

*New York**$86,500 to $196,500*

*Maryland**$86,500 to $157,200*

title: Warehouse Management Analyst
description:
As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture’s clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today’s biggest business challenges. You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources.

**Job Description:**

The **Warehouse Management Analyst** will have the following responsibilities:

* Material re-balance between sites.
* Vendor shipment tracking, metrics and material visibility.
* Task management.
* Material disposition.
* Follow up with manufacturers on schedules and align transportation companies on Estimated Time of Arrivals (ETAs).
* Daily and weekly tracking on inbound racks. Track actual v. physical delivery dates from manufacturer to data centers and other Client locations.
* Support data reporting for warehouse storage management / utilization.
* Inventory aging metrics across data center materials. Reclass slow moving, obsolete, aging inventory, etc. as “Available” & “To Be Disposed”.
* Inventory management and trend root cause analysis.
* Create shipment request for inventory rebalancing & disposition activities within “Available” & “To Be Disposed” pool.
* Coordinating closely with field team and cross-functional partners to align on inventory evaluation and reduce inventory aging.
* Data analysis & reporting: Lead reporting for logistics and inventory management programs.

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 2 years of experience in Distribution Center and Logistics operations

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience in high-tech industry and/or data center operations
* Bachelor’s degree

**Professional Skills Requirements:**

* Proficient user of Excel, including use of formulas, chart and pivot tables

title: Professional Electrologist
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Professional Electrologist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for providing exceptional service to clients. The successful candidate will have a thorough understanding of electrology and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding role that offers the opportunity to make a difference in people's lives, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide high-quality electrolysis treatments to clients To enhance client’s appearance.  
- Provide exceptional customer service to ensure client satisfaction and loyalty.  
- Stay up-to-date with the latest techniques and best practices in the field of electrology.  
- Maintain a clean and organized work environment that meets the highest standards of hygiene and safety.

Experience:  
- Proven experience as a Professional Electrologist, with a focus on providing high-quality treatments and exceptional customer service.  
- Strong understanding of various electrology treatments and techniques.  
- Certification in electrology.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.  
- Strong attention to detail and commitment to providing a high level of client satisfaction.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Rotating weekends
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Commute:

* Scarsdale, NY 10583 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Scarsdale, NY 10583: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Scrum Master - 5441354
description:
**Accenture Flex** offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.


As an **Accenture Flex** employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.


You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. **Accenture Flex** employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

**Key Responsibilities:**


As a Scrum Master, you will be responsible for acting as an enabler for the effective functioning of a software development team using Agile methodologies. Your day-to-day activities will include

* Coaching and mentoring the Scrum Team(s)
* Removing barriers to successful implementation
* Facilitating scrum and agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
* You will also be expected to be an SME, collaborate and manage the team to perform, make team decisions, engage with multiple teams, and contribute to key decisions.
* Provide solutions to problems for your immediate team and across multiple teams.
* Implement innovative strategies to improve team performance and efficiency
* Identify and implement best practices for Agile methodologies
* Facilitate continuous improvement through regular retrospectives
* Promote a collaborative and inclusive team culture
* Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in Agile methods

  

**Basic Qualification:**

* A minimum of 4 years of experience with Scrum
* A minimum of 4 years of experience with Agile Methodologies
* A minimum of 4 years of experience with Agile Coaching
* Associate's degree

**Preferred Qualification:**

* Experience working in Banking industry
* Experience with RTE

title: Security Consulting Manager- Products A&D
description:
**We Are**


We are a global collective of innovators applying the New every day to improve the way the world works and lives. Help us show the world what’s possible as you partner with clients to unlock hidden value and deliver innovative solutions. Empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of diverse talent and perspectives, we drive success in a new business architecture that disrupts conventional practices. Our expertise spans 40+ industries across 120+ countries and impacts millions of lives every day. We turn ideas into reality.


Accenture Security helps organizations prepare, protect, detect, respond and recover along all points of the security lifecycle. Cybersecurity challenges are different for every business in every industry. Leveraging our global resources and advanced technologies, we create integrated, turnkey solutions tailored to our clients’ needs across their entire value chain. Whether we’re defending against known cyberattacks, detecting and responding to the unknown, or running an entire security operations center, we will help companies build cyber resilience to grow with confidence. Our team of the security sector’s brightest people use the coolest tech to out-hack the hackers and help clients build resilience from within. We blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security and managed service solutions to rethink the entire security lifecycle.

**You Are**


We are currently looking for professionals for our **Aerospace and Defense (A&D) Security** practice with extensive experience in the following:

**A&D Security Manager:**


Our A&D Security teams help clients identify and evaluate security gaps, subsequently driving the implementation of solutions to mitigate security exposure while meeting regulatory requirements (e.g. NIST, CMMC). They possess relevant cybersecurity technical skills through leading large-scale projects and continuous research of the latest security vulnerabilities, threats, capabilities, and mitigation techniques. They are expected to anticipate security requirements, analyze and understand the client security posture and formulate right-sized solutions based on industry leading practices.


.


The A&D Security Manager is responsible for leading and managing complex information security engagements. They provide subject matter expertise and drive project delivery execution as the primary point of contact for client stakeholders, typically at the director, senior director and C-suite levels. The A&D Security Senior Manager will work with our clients to develop new opportunities, scope engagements and ensure quality delivery of work performed.


Additionally, the A&D Security Manager is expected to understand and have in depth experience in many of the domain areas identified: Cyber Defense, Cloud Security (Government and Commercial Cloud environments – Azure GCC High, AWS GovCloud, GCP), Infrastructure/Network Security, Threat and Vulnerability Management, Advanced Security Analytics, Data Security, Identity Management, Security Operations, Application Security, Supply Chain Security and Managed Security Services working closely with the leadership to develop go to market solutions and implement them for our clients.

**Key Responsibilities will include:**

* Delivery of Accenture's Security offerings related to cybersecurity with a focus on security program enhancements across multiple domain areas, security maturity risk assessments, and implementation of technical security solutions and tools
* Managing and leading large-scale complex cybersecurity engagements with resources distributed across the US and globally
* Coaching and developing teams of managers, consultants and security analysts
* Lead and support business development activities including developing proposal responses and managing sales pipeline
* Deliver new security capabilities and assets to drive business opportunities and support project delivery

**The Work**

* Working directly with clients and Accenture teams to design and implement program strategies for cybersecurity, including Cyber Defense, Cloud Security, Infrastructure/Network Security, Threat and Vulnerability Management. Advanced Security Analytics, Data Security, Identity Management, Security Operations, Supply Chain Security, and Managed Security Services
* Analyzing client’s security posture to create current state assessment, gap analysis, and strategic implementation roadmaps adhering to client’s and regulatory requirements
* Performing requirements analysis and developing strategies and solutions for cybersecurity, risk, and information governance
* Performing risk remediation cost-benefit-analysis for a variety of solutions
* Establishing return on investment and business process improvements for investments in cybersecurity programs and technologies
* Developing and integrating cybersecurity metrics and reporting programs for key security, privacy, risk, compliance, and service continuity indicators against regulatory standards (e.g. NIST, CMMC, etc.)
* Maintain positive rapport with client relationship through effective communications. Play substantive or lead role in establishing and maintaining quality internal and external communications to include deliverables, technical content of reports, proposals, etc.
* Develop working relationships with Senior Executives and Senior Managers across the A&D client account teams to drive work in across the industry
* Demonstrate knowledge of A&D Industry and functional specialty Project and program management experience, proven ability to lead project delivery and/or multiple projects delivery
* Monitor project economics and client billing
* Demonstrate ability to ensure implementation of security solutions
* Identify security opportunities to cross-sell other services
* Translating technical requirements into business terms for executive stakeholders

  

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.


  

**Here is What You Need**

* Minimum of 5 years experience in Cybersecurity and Information Technology in the Aerospace and Defense Industry and government (e.g. Department of Defense).
* Minimum of 5 years of overall technical hands-on security experience
* Minimum of 5 years management experience (people and programs/projects)
* Minimum of 5 years experience in designing, developing, implementing, and managing solutions across cybersecurity domains (Cyber Defense, Cloud Security, Infrastructure/Network Security, Threat and Vulnerability Management, Application Security, Advanced Security Analytics, Data Security, Identity Management, Security Operations, Supply Chain Security, Managed Security Services, etc.)
* Minimum of 3 years experience in a program/project leadership role interfacing with clients, managing budgets and ensuring implementation is of quality within the team.
* Minimum Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. If Associate's Degree, must have equivalent minimum 6 years work experience.

**Bonus points in you have**

* Industry recognized security qualifications, such as CISSP
* Candidates will have broad security architect skills with solid understanding of cross functional IT Security areas such as Cloud Security, Infrastructure/Network Security, Identity and Access Management, Application Security, Data Protection, Security Operations, Supply Chain Security, and Managed Security Services or security outsourcing delivery and/or experience as a Security Engineer or Security Architect for security products and services with proven ability to develop/solution deals.
* Prior experience in a client-facing, consulting environment, managing and directing project teams of consultants
* A strong reputation and presence in the security industry
* A robust knowledge of security vendors in key security domains, and detailed security product capabilities
* Must be conversant in security issues, cyber threats, and vulnerability trends
* Must be conversant in project management principles and project quality methods

**Professional Skill Requirements:**

* Eagerness to contribute in a team-orientated environment
* Ability to lead a team with minimal direction
* Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
* Desire to work in an information security environment
* Desire to help contribute and grow the practice
* Desire to mentor and educate others
* Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
* Comfortable with C-Level interaction
* Must have strong attention to detail

title: Sales Excellence – Bid Management Manager - CMT
description:
**About Accenture:**


At Accenture, we believe your career is about what you want to be and who you want to be. It’s about bringing your skills, your curiosity, and your best true self to your work. Here, you’ll match your ingenuity with the latest technology to do incredible things. Together, we can create positive, long-lasting change.

**We Are:**


Sales Excellence. Sales Excellence at Accenture empowers our people to compete, win and grow. We develop everything they need to grow their client portfolios, optimize their deals and enable their sales talent, all driven by sales intelligence.

**You Are:**


A connector of dots as well as people. Like a mountain guide, you lead diverse teams towards a common goal with clear communication. You are a motivator. As the climb gets tough, you keep the group focused on the summit while you navigate obstacles along the way. You enjoy bringing talented people together and charting the path to shared success.

**The Work:**


As a Sales Excellence Manager, you manage deal teams throughout the entire bid lifecycle. You use your sales process knowledge to ensure the right resources are engaged in preparing, developing, and negotiating bids that meet and exceed client requirements.

**You will:**

* Understand clients’ needs and work with deal leadership to define win strategies and messaging
* Determine what expertise are needed to develop a compelling offer and plan resources accordingly
* Drive bid activities and facilitate communication across teams and workstreams
* Build and nurture positive relationship with key deal team stakeholders
* Seek opportunities to optimize the bid management process and tools
* Develop yourself and others through continuous learning and knowledge sharing

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 6 years of experience in bid management, sales or presales work.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree
* MBA
* Experience with sales, sales enablement and negotiations fundamentals.
* Familiarity with concepts such as design thinking fundamentals, pipeline management, deal qualification, competitive positioning, client relationship strategy, relationship management techniques, deal shaping or financial modeling.
* Contract drafting management fundamentals.
* Understanding of basic concepts of outsourcing, business process services, or Cloud, Security or other Technology aspects, platforms, or current trends
* Experience working with professional services industry.
* Experience working on large, global, and complex multi-million-dollar opportunities containing multiple types of work.

**Professional Skills**

* Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian.
* Ability to work across multiple time zones

**Other requirements (please specify such as overtime, etc.)**

* Must support/mirror work hours for the supported Market Unit or other business area.
* Must be flexible with work hours according to business needs.
* Must have good internet connectivity and a distraction-free environment for working at home, in accordance with local guidelines.
* May be occasionally required to travel domestically or internationally.

**Additional Comments**

* Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.

title: Student Transportation Driver
description:
**Ridgefield Public Schools Student Transportation Driver - Please apply at www.ridgefield.org**

**Overview:** 

**The student transportation driver is a 12-month part-time position in the mornings and/or afternoons. The driver is responsible for maintaining a safe environment for students traveling to and living within the Town of Ridgefield traveling to schools outside of town lines. Drivers will pick up and drop off students at stops along established routes each day within the school calendar schedule as well as summer programs. The driver may also transport students to a work study program within town. Drivers must be attentive to traffic and weather conditions while staying on schedule and ensuring the safety of the passengers. The driver must ensure that the vehicle is operating properly by conducting a vehicle inspection each day. Drivers are also responsible for maintaining a safe environment within the bus by enforcing rules on conduct and responding to emergencies that may arise.**

**Responsibilities:**

* **Driving children to and from school related activities.**
* **Greet parents and children in a friendly and reassuring manner.**
* **Ensure that the child is secured in the seat at all times during transport.**
* **The driver must ensure that their vehicles are operating properly and conduct a vehicle inspection each day and report any items that require corrective action.**
* **Ensure that the vehicle is in compliance with laws and standard operating procedures.**
* **Must be attentive to traffic and weather conditions while staying on schedule and ensuring the safety of the passengers.**
* **Communicate and report all disciplinary issues and incidents pertaining to the transportation of children.**
* **Remain consistent with stop schedules and route instructions and accurate record of stop times.**
* **Reinforce school bus rider rules while supervising students.**
* **Develop a positive professional relationship with parents, school staff, and students.**
* **Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both orally and in writing, with emphasis on oral communication skills.**
* **Ability to handle problems and stressful situations.**
* **Ability to maintain confidentiality.**
* **Maintain a clean and organized vehicle to promote a healthy environment.**

**Requirements:**

* **HS Diploma or GED. Clean driving and criminal background.**
* **Must be able to pass DOT physical and drug screening.**
* **Passing of a Public Service License with a V endorsement required.**
* **Training will be provided for Mandated Reporting.**

**Qualifications:**

* **Must have 5 years of safe driving experience and good knowledge of local geography.**
* **Training will be provided through the Ridgefield Public Schools contracted Pupil Transportation provider.**
* **Must have skill and experience supervising children.**
* **Demonstrate empathy for each child and their needs.**
* **Experience with school aged students preferred.**

**Rate of Pay: $24.00 per hour**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $24.00 per hour

Experience:

* Van driver: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Ridgefield, CT 06877 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Ridgefield, CT 06877: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Behavioral Assistant Needed in Central Jersey!
description:
**Behavioral Assistant (BA)**

**Who is Neuropath Behavioral Healthcare:** 

Neuropath Behavioral Healthcare provides Comprehensive Youth and Family Support Services to primary caregivers of children and teens with Developmental and Intellectual Disabilities. Serving the state of New Jersey. We are looking for Part Time Behavioral Assistants (BA’s) to join our team!

**Benefits/Compensation:**

* Starting Rate $25.00/hour
* We are open to referrals, please inquire about when speaking with your recruiter
* A dynamic work environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Ongoing Job Training
* Group Health Coverage
* Full-timers get 80 hours Paid Time Off Annually
* Part-timers get 40 hours Paid Time Off Annually
* Short/ Long Term Disability
* Ancillary Health Benefits from AFLAC

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* A BA will visit the client at home or in the community to provide relief to caregivers and holistic support to youth. Our BA’s typically work 2-20 hours weekly in 2-4 hour shifts starting after 3 pm during the school year and as early as 8:30 am during the summer. Services are available any day of the week to accommodate the scheduling needs of our clients.
* Individual Support Plan development and implementation
* Delivery and monitoring of behavior analysis services
* Submission of weekly clinical progress notes, within 24 hours of service provision Intake Data Assessments
* Data collection and display (e.g., graphics) as authorized by a recipient’s behavioral analysis service plan
* Compliance with service authorization, including time frames and service hours
* Implement interventions in the Individual Support Plan
* Implementation of behavioral procedures for the acquisition of replacement skills reduction of problematic behaviors
* Carry out treatment as designated by the supervising behavior analyst which includes:
* Facilitating environmental arrangements
* Using proactive strategies
* Teaching and developing new skills
* Managing specific consequences for behavior based on function
* Must be willing to work with the child or youth to increase ADL (Assisted Daily Living) skills within their home as well as during community outings
* Assist parent/guardian in the implementation of the treatment plan
* Assist the behavior analyst in training of caregivers and/or staff
* Crisis prevention, recognition, and intervention
* Ensure all agency policies are implemented and followed
* Participate in required training

**Skills/Abilities:**

* Active Listening & Critical Thinking
* Positive leadership
* Patience & Understanding
* Compassion
* Adaptability
* Reliability & Attentiveness
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
* Understanding of evidence-based interventions for individuals with behavioral and developmental disabilities
* Willing to be a positive role model and provide emotional & psychological support to clients
* Knowledge of behavioral interventions

**Qualifications:**

* Must have completed free CSOC Behavioral Assistant Certification course or be able to complete within 6 months of hire… For more information: https://www.nj.gov/dcf/providers/csc/training/
* Bachelor’s Degree in psychology or related field
* 2-4 years experience in behavioral healthcare (maladaptive behaviors)
* 2-4 years experience working with children with disabilities (developmental/intellectual disabilities, mental illness)
* Valid NJ Driver’s license and proof of car insurance
* Consent to and pass State/Federal Criminal Background Checks
* Bilingual (Spanish Speaking) Welcome

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 2 – 20 per week

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Merchandise Manager
description:
VCNY Home is a forward-thinking home textiles supplier offering modern designs for every lifestyle and budget; we specialize in bedding, bath, window treatments, area rugs, home décor, and table linens. We empower our employees to think creatively and autonomously to take their careers and our company to the next level.

**We offer:**

A business casual work environment, **FREE on-site gym**, *complimentary shuttle service from Secaucus train station*, and **work from home on Fridays!!**

Heath, Vision & Dental Benefits, Flex spending, Transit, and 401K plan.

***Responsibilities***

* Develop customer intimacy through regular store visits and competitive shopping; apply findings with the Sales and Product Development team.
* Develop and present an overall product assortment for each season.
* Supervise product development process to ensure that the merchandise consistently appeals to the customer's needs.
* Responsible for all meetings and outcomes and make sure the team adheres to project deadlines.
* Communicate with company management to recommend business opportunities and ways to increase sales and optimize profit.
* Partner with Design and stay current on fashion and technology trends. Bring customer and market perspective to the design and product development process.
* Approve sketches, color prints, concepts with Design team.
* Collaborate with design, product development and sourcing staff to meet costing targets on all products developed seasonally.
* Attend sales meetings and make presentations as needed.

***Qualifications/Experience***

* Bachelor’s Degree required.
* 5+ years in Home Textiles/ Fashion Apparel merchandising, both soft and hard home goods
* Must have acute sense of customer intimacy and product category.
* Strong English language skills, written and verbal.
* Able to make presentations in front of customers.
* Strategic thinking and management skills.
* Multi-functional with excellent organizational skills.
* Computer literate. Knowledge of Design a plus.
* Excellent analytic skills needed with a knowledge of P& L, costing/margins

Salary DOE

title: Director of Major Gifts
description:
**Director of Major Gifts**

**Full Time | Days and some Evenings included| Monday-Friday | 8:30am-5pm | Hybrid/Remote**

***\\*\\* Minimum salary starting at $105,400/year; based on experience\\*\\****


United Methodist Communities has been certified ***A Great Place to Work*** for the 7th year in a row, **87% of our team members say they feel they make a difference in the work that they do at UMC!**

*The* ***Director of Major Gifts*** *is responsible for the strategic direction and management of key donors and fundraising initiatives essential to developing, expanding, and stewarding major philanthropic support. The role involves frequent contact with major donors and prospects, as well as interaction with board members, volunteers, and key stakeholders of UMC and UMC Foundation. The focus will be on securing major gifts defined as $10,000 and up. The* ***Director of Major Gifts*** *will report to the VP, Foundation.*

**Requirements for a Director of Major Gifts:**

* Bachelor's degree in nonprofit management, fundraising, business, marketing, or related field.
* Master's degree preferred.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience in nonprofit fundraising, with a focus on major gifts and individual giving.
* Proven track record of successfully securing major gifts from individuals, foundations, and corporations with demonstrated experience in donor cultivation, solicitation, and stewardship.
* Proficiency in donor management software and other electronic platforms utilized by the organization.
* Experience with Microsoft environment.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to craft compelling solicitation materials and present effectively to diverse audiences.
* CRM database experience preferred.
* CFRE certification preferred.

**Responsibilities for a Director of Major Gifts:**

* Creates and implements an innovative annual strategic fundraising plan. Periodically adjusts and revises plan as appropriate to ensure the team exceeds all revenue goals.
* Builds and maintains a portfolio of major gift prospects, defined as $10,000-plus gifts.
* Establishes and cultivates relationships with existing donors through gift acknowledgments, events, and other stewardship practices.
* Creates and submits customized funding proposals for funds in support of UMC priorities to current and prospective funders, cultivating and soliciting major and endowment gifts from individuals and family/corporate foundations.
* Utilizes resources and coordinates with our Communications team to produce fundraising materials, donor recognition and stewardship materials.
* Utilizes internal and external constituent management database to manage all fundraising activities. Keeps track of financials and moves management.
* Stays informed regarding best practices in philanthropy and fundraising and proactively seeks opportunities for personal professional development and organizational growth.

**About UMC:**

* Our Mission is: **Compassionately serving in community so that all are free to choose abundant life**
* Certified **A Great Place to Work** for the last 7 years, we continue to grow and innovate to meet the needs of our residents while building upon our rich history of over 115-years of dedication to the communities we serve. Over 80% of our team members say they feel good about the ways UMC contributes to the community!
* According to the **2024 Great Place to Work Survey, 87% of our team members:**
	+ Feel they **make a difference** and their work has **special meaning**
	+ Indicate they are **able to take time off work** when necessary
	+ Feel their workplace is physically **SAFE**!
* We offer 4 Full-Service Communities, 5 Affordable Housing Communities and HomeWorks throughout the State of NJ, offering a variety of options from Independent Living, Assisted Living, Memory Care, Long Term Care, Short Term Rehab, home care and more!
* Our company culture at UMC is built on our values of Compassion, Respect, Stewardship and Service.

**Benefits offered by UMC for our Associates/Team Members:**

* Employer-subsidized Medical and Dental Coverage (eligible at 30-hours per week)
* 403(b) Retirement Savings Program with Employer Match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Assistance, Professional Development and E-Learning
* Employee Discount Program
* Homeowner/Renter/Automobile Insurance (NJ Manufacturers)
* Generous Paid Time Off Program
* Group Life Insurance (No Cost to YOU!)
* 9 Paid Holidays/Premium Pay when working holidays
* Free uniform items & additional uniform allowances
* Additional great benefits like Vision coverage, Health Savings Account, Voluntary Life Insurance & so much more!

*UMC is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by laws and regulations.*

title: Retirement Account Manager
description:
**JOB SUMMARY: Retirement Account Manager**

* Performs compliance testing; contribution calculations; Form 5500 reporting; Manages Client Relationship.

***Essential******Responsibilities:***

* Main point of client and advisor contact providing a high level of service to clients and advisors.
* Ensures all clients are receiving feedback and resolution to their inquiries on a daily basis
* Interpret plan documents
* Thorough knowledge of ERISA, IRS & DOL regulations regarding qualified plans
* Analyzes census to determine eligibility
* Calculate employer contributions based on the plan's provisions and confirms with client amount of annual funding
* Preparation of annual non-discrimination tests (ADP/ACP; 415; 402(g), 416, 410(b)) and ability to discuss testing results with client
* Prepare Government Forms: 5500 and Related Schedules, 5558, 5330, 8955 and works with plan's auditor and ability to discuss Forms with the client.
* Works with plan's Form 5500 auditor
* Posts year-end client deliverables to Pension Pro
* Reconciliation of trust assets
* Review and approve participant requested loans and distribution requests
* Identifies and completes RMD distributions
* Advises clients on new plan design options and completes plan studies when needed
* Works with assigned Administrator to ensure deadlines are met timely
* Responsible for entering amendment requests in Pension Pro; updating Relius specs, platform specs, obtaining signatures and follow-ups with clients.
* Requesting record-keeper enrollment forms and updating plan specs during amendment process.
* Attends client and advisor calls/meetings upon request with approval from assigned Manager.
* Annual year-end clean-up to include follow-up on forfeiture re-allocations, source transfers determined during the compliance review
* Work with clients to terminate their plan

**OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE HAS...**

* **Certifications/Designations:** ASPPA Designations a plus or be willing to obtain designations
* **Education:** Bachelors Degree preferred.
* **Experience:** 3+ years of Defined Contribution (DC) retirement compliance and service experience. Previous/current experience of managing a caseload of 70-90 defined contribution plans, including 401 (k) and 403(b). Experience using Sungard Relius compliance software needed! Experience with multiple employer plans (MEPs) preferred.
* **Skills/Knowledge:** Excellent client relationship, communication, organizational, and problem solving skills. Ability to work in a fast paced team environment. Working knowledge of FT Williams Government forms & Salesforce a plus.

 **ABOUT OUR CLIENT:**

MP's client is a leading provider of retirement plans and fiduciary outsourcing solutions nationwide. As one of America's oldest independent fiduciaries, they deliver retirement plans that run with less risk, greater efficiencies and improved outcomes. With an 80-year legacy of fiduciary expertise and oversight unmatched in the industry today, they partner with firms at the advisor, sponsor and enterprise level to bring maximum flexibility to every opportunity, offering a comprehensive array of retirement plan solutions, plan consulting, TPA services and fiduciary support.

 **ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**

* **Location:** Remote within the United States!
* **Compensation Range:** Salary paid position $80k - $90k per year. This is determined by education, certifications/designations, and experience.
* **Competitive Benefits:** Medical, Dental, Vision, and more!

title: Ophthalmic Technician
description:
**Ophthalmic Technician**  
Spinak Medical Eye Center

Pearl River, NY 10965

Stony Point, NY 10980

**Job details**

* Salary: competitive hourly rate based on experience
* Job Type: Full-time
* Schedule: Monday-Friday

**Qualifications**

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)
* Ophthalmology: minimum 1 year (Preferred)

**Full Job Description**

Spinak Medical Eye Center is a busy Ophthalmology Practice with two locations in Rockland County, Pearl River and Stony Point. Our board certified Ophthalmologists and Optometrist provide a wide range of services including routine and comprehensive eye exams, contact lenses, minor procedures, Laser Vision Correction, cataract surgery, cosmetic surgery and more! We are currently seeking a highly-motivated Ophthalmic Technician with a strong work ethic to enhance our team. Applicants must be flexible, dependable, compassionate, team-oriented and comfortable in a fast paced environment.

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Patient works ups: obtain personal and family histories, update medication lists, obtain chief complaints, Visual Acuity, Auto-Refractions, Manual Refractions.
* Testing: Macula OCT, Nerve OCT, A Scan, B Scan, IOL Master, Tonometry, Pachymetry, Corneal Topography, Wavefront Scans, fundus photos, external photos, Endo Cell Count, Tear Lab, Lipiscan.
* Medications: E-Prescribing, Prior Authorizations, administration of drops for dilation, numbing, pre-procedure.
* Additional responsibilities: Maintaining inventory, exam rooms and supplies, sterilizing equipment, scribing, assist in minor and laser procedures, thorough clinical documentation of patient records including EMR, obtain patient consent.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.00 - $25.00 per hour
