title: Real Estate Analyst
description:
Responsible for commercial real estate valuation, appraisal review and property tax activities as they relate to AHS Investment Corp. (AHSIC) and Atlantic Health System (AHS).
  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Oversees all commercial real estate valuation and appraisals for leases, subleases, and timeshares.
  

2. Represents Real Estate's best interests and activities while communicating and negotiating with private physician practices.
  

3. Documents the market rent rates and property sale valuations for compliance with applicable federal regulations related to medical offices.
  

4. Prepares, analyzes and files property tax forms for appropriate municipalities. Works with legal department and real estate appraisers on tax appeals and related matters.
  

5. Engages in computer software applications, technologies, systems and procedures related to commercial real estate.
  

6. Demonstrates a positive, professional, and client-oriented attitude about the company with coworkers, tenants, clients, and the public whether contact is by mail, e-mail, telephone, or in person.
  

7. Interfaces with legal department, facilities department, construction department and local tax assessors, as necessary.
  

8. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor's degree
  

2. 5+ years experience in commercial property valuation or relevant area.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Bachelor's or Masters' degree in real estate.
  

2. Experience in appraisal related software.
  

3. Certification or Designation from a professional real estate appraisal organization.

title: Direct Support Professional Relief - PDM183 - On-Call
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:** Provide all aspects of care to program participants to enable them to become independent and productive. Some knowledge of computers is needed.
  
  

**ESSENTIAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:**  

Each DSP must be able to perform the following functions in order to ensure the life safety, care and well-being of the people served by WellLife Network.
  
1. Ensures that all activities enhance and support each program participants social responsibility, independence, dignity and continued growth.
  
2. Implements goals designed to maximize each program participants level of independence, as determined by the IDT, including but not limited to: budgeting, grooming, nutritional planning, use of public transportation, and use of community resources, shopping and housekeeping.
  
3. Must successfully complete and perform all techniques required in AMAP, SCIP, CPR and First Aid. Employment is conditional upon passing the exams for each course.
  
4. Coordinates evacuation and ensures safety in actual emergencies and fire drills. Essential functions of this duty include: the ability to climb and descend fire escapes and assist others to do the same. This may include both verbal and physical prompting and the ability to perform first aid for the people served.
  
5. Administers medication and/or monitors self-administration of medication as a certified AMAP. This includes documentation of the computerized EMAR (Electronic Medication Administration Record) system, where applicable. (This may not apply to relief staff).
  
6. Responsible for crisis intervention and incident reporting procedures.
  
7. Responsible for monitoring and recording progress on daily checklists, any behavior contracts, quarterly summaries, monthly goal forms and progress notes, family contact log, monthly and daily recreation reports, clothing and personal effects inventory.
  
8. Required to display proficiency while entering person served data documentation in the electronic data system.
  
9. Communicates relevant information to other staff and supervisor(s), verbally and in writing, (i.e., daily communication log, telephone log, incident reports, medication and behavior incident reports.)
  
10. Meets routinely with people served and the management team to review goal progress, identify participant needs and update program plans. Assists in researching and obtaining community resources appropriate and applicable to their needs and goals.
  
11. Assists in planning and follow through on or escorts program participants to evening and weekend recreational activities. Participates in moderate physical activities as part of recreation program.
  
12. Assists in planning of daily activities and events.
  
13. Provides training in ADL and other areas, performs these functions for people served requiring total support (diaper changing, ambulation, G-Tube, feeding, transferring from bed to chair using Hoyer lift), specifically staff will perform all aspects of the task i.e., showering, shaving, toileting, hand washing, mouth care.
  
14. Attends all scheduled staff meetings, mandatory in-service training sessions, and assigned annual meetings within the residence and day program.
  
15. Acts as a role model for people served in various settings/situations.
  
16. Follows-up on any aftercare/recommendations for treatment. Escorts/accompanies people served as needed on appointments (medical, psychiatric, etc.).
  
17. Maintains confidentiality at all times.
  
18. Work schedules and locations are subject to change based upon person served and/or program need.
  
19. Other duties as requested.
  
  

High School diploma or equivalency diploma required. Experience working with adults with intellectual/developmental or other behavioral health disabilities preferred.

-------------------------------

title: Retail Assistant Store Manager (Full-Time)
description:
Our Assistant Store Managers play an important role in creating a memorable customer experience. They support our day to day store operations, help develop our store employees, and act as product and brand ambassadors for Skechers.***Compensation & Benefit Information***

***Starting Rate: $22.18***

***Range is: $21.68 - $23.53***

* Generous employee discount for Skechers footwear, apparel & accessories
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits & Flexible Spending Accounts
* Life & Short/Long Term Disability Benefits
* Parental Leave
* Pet Insurance
* Competitive 401(k) Program
* Paid Time Off Benefits including paid vacation, personal time & sick time
* Virtual Health Care & Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Skechers Foundation Scholarship Program
* Community Focus
* Employee Referral Bonus Program
**Main Responsibilities**

* Champion the brand.
* Deliver an amazing customer experience through product and visual marketing excellence as well as outstanding customer service.
* Assists with developing store employees, coaching and mentoring store teams on product knowledge, setting customer service expectations, and demonstrating visual presentation standards.
* Support new hire onboarding.
* Assists with managing store scheduling needs, ensuring proper coverage for peak times.
* Act as a product expert and serve as a brand ambassador for all things Skechers.
* Ensure strong operational processes and routines that drive profitability and results.
* Act as the expert on all store systems and processes including opening and closing of the POS.
* May be responsible for the opening and closing of the store as needed.

**Skills, Qualifications and Experience**

* Ability and desire to foster a respectful, safe, and fun environment for Skechers store employees.
* Comfortable communicating expectations with store employees, sets clear expectations for the team.
* Flexible and motivated to provide excellent customer service.
* Creates excitement and shows passion for Skechers products and the brand.
* Retail, restaurant, or hospitality experience is preferred but not required.

***Range is: $21.68 - $23.53***

**About Skechers**  

Skechers (NYSE: SKX), a global, Fortune 500® brand develops and markets a diverse range of lifestyle and performance footwear, apparel, and accessories. Developing comfort technologies is the foundation of all we do – delivering stylish, innovative, and quality products. Serving over 180 countries and territories, Skechers connects customers to products through department and specialty stores, e-commerce and digital stores, and through our more than 5,200 company-and third-party-owned retail locations. Headquartered in Southern California, with offices and distribution centers around the globe, Skechers has spent 30 years helping people of all ages look and feel good.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**  

Skechers is committed to providing a safe, inclusive, and respectful work environment. Skechers provides equal employment opportunities for all employees and applicants for employment without regard race, color, religion, gender, gender identification and expression, national origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, military status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic established by local, state or federal law.

 **Reasonable Accommodation**  

Applicants for employment who require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job should request appropriate accommodation by emailing benefits@skechers.com.  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job responsibility satisfactorily. The skills, abilities and physical demands described are representative of those duties that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities, who are otherwise qualified for the job position, to perform the essential functions.

title: Retail Sales Associate (Part-Time)
description:
The role of a Skechers Product Specialist (Sales Associate) is to provide an excellent customer experience. Product Specialists are enthusiastic and welcoming, they serve as Skechers product experts and are committed to customer satisfaction.***Compensation Information***

***Starting Rate: $17.00***

***Range is: $16.50- $18.04***

**Main Responsibilities**

* Drive sales through excellent customer service.
* Act as a product expert and serve as a brand ambassador for all things Skechers, using this knowledge to guide customers to the right product selection.
* Continuously ensuring floor inventory is well maintained, merchandising, stocking and cleaning – whatever it takes to create a premier shopping experience for the customer.
* Efficiently process customer transactions, discounts, etc. at the point of sale. Accepts returns professionally and encourages exchanges or alternatives where possible, striving to always maintain the customer relationship.
* Stays up to date on the latest Skechers’ product knowledge.

**Skills, Qualifications and Experience**

* Loves being a part of the team and treats every coworker with respect and positivity.
* Previous retail, restaurant, or hospitality experience preferred but not required.
* Work availability should be open to the store’s needs.
* Flexible and motivated to provide excellent customer service.
* Strong attention to detail.

***Range is: $16.50- $18.04***

**About Skechers**  

Skechers (NYSE: SKX), a global, Fortune 500® brand develops and markets a diverse range of lifestyle and performance footwear, apparel, and accessories. Developing comfort technologies is the foundation of all we do – delivering stylish, innovative, and quality products. Serving over 180 countries and territories, Skechers connects customers to products through department and specialty stores, e-commerce and digital stores, and through our more than 5,200 company-and third-party-owned retail locations. Headquartered in Southern California, with offices and distribution centers around the globe, Skechers has spent 30 years helping people of all ages look and feel good.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**  

Skechers is committed to providing a safe, inclusive, and respectful work environment. Skechers provides equal employment opportunities for all employees and applicants for employment without regard race, color, religion, gender, gender identification and expression, national origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, military status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic established by local, state or federal law.

 **Reasonable Accommodation**  

Applicants for employment who require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job should request appropriate accommodation by emailing benefits@skechers.com.  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job responsibility satisfactorily. The skills, abilities and physical demands described are representative of those duties that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities, who are otherwise qualified for the job position, to perform the essential functions.

title: Retail Warehouse Associate
description:
As a Retail Warehouse Associate, you’ll be part of an energetic and efficient team that’s dedicated to delivering tech products from the store’s warehouse to our customers when, where and how they need them. You’ll retrieve and ship products, restock shelves and take inventory to ensure a great shopping experience. When the situation calls for it, you’ll also directly assist customers and collaborate with other employees on the sales floor.  

  

**What you’ll do*** Unload trucks and record store inventory
* Prepare products to be shipped to other stores and costumers’ homes
* Stock shelves and organize merchandise displays to help customers see what’s possible and quickly purchase products
* Follow established safety guidelines while operating store equipment
* Replenish products daily to ensure they’re fully stocked on the sales floor
* Process online orders and assist other employees with store pickup orders

**Basic qualifications*** Working and thriving in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Working a flexible schedule that matches your availability (weekends, nights, holidays, etc.)
* Moving up to 100 pounds with or without accommodation

**What’s in it for you**  

  

We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  

  

Our benefits include:* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  

  

As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  

  

Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  

Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.  

  

**Application deadline:** Minimum of 5 days from the posting date. You can find that date above the job title at the top of the page.
company_description: Best Buy is a leading provider of technology products, services and solutions.

title: Director of Dietary
company: The Garden of Eden Assisted Living Facility
description:
**Overview:**  
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Director of Dietary to join our team. As a Director of Dietary, you will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations and ensuring the highest quality of food preparation and service. This is a supervisory role that requires strong leadership abilities and a passion for providing excellent customer service. This position reports to Administrator.

**Duties:**

* Supervise Facility kitchen operations including meals preparation/ maintaining, ordering food
* Knowledge of NYC DOH/ NYSDoN regulations regarding proper food handling and sanitation in health care facilities
* Perform administrative duties: hiring, training, scheduling, leading and when necessary, terminating kitchen staff
* Assist with purchasing food and kitchen supplies
* Interpret the Food Services Department’s policies and procedures to employees, residents, government agencies, etc., as necessary
* Ensure proper control of equipment and supplies
* Ensure that menus are maintained and filed under current industry standards of practice.
* Ensure kitchen staff members are following menus
* Maintain the utmost cleanliness of the kitchen areas
* Inform Administrator of any complaints or concerns

**Skills:**

* Strong knowledge of NYC DOH/ NYSDoN regulations and practices regarding food safety in Assisted living facility
* Proven experience in food preparation, preferably in a healthcare facility
* Excellent supervisory skills with the ability to lead and motivate a team
* Knowledge of kitchen equipment operation and maintenance
* Exceptional organizational and time management skills
* Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Degree/ certification in Nutrition or related field
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite programs

**Requirements**:

* NYC Food Handler Certificate required
* Ideal candidate would have managerial experience and would be able to lead by example
* Ideal candidate would have prior experience in assisted living facility, nursing care facility, hospital or other related medical facilities
* Ideal candidate would be knowledgeable of dietary practices and procedures and the laws, regulations, and guidelines governing dietary functions in the Assisted Living Facility.
* Must be organized, self-motivated, obtain leadership skills and be able to work well with others.

If you are a dedicated individual with a passion for providing exceptional food service and have the skills and qualifications outlined above, we would love to hear from you.

title: Echo Tech
description:
**Overview:**

We are seeking an experienced Echo Technician to join our medical team. In this role, you will perform high-quality echocardiograms to assist physicians in diagnosing and managing heart conditions. If you have a passion for patient care and expertise in cardiac imaging, we’d love to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform echocardiographic examinations to produce detailed images of the heart for diagnostic purposes.
* Prepare and position patients for echocardiography procedures, ensuring their comfort and safety.
* Operate and maintain echocardiography equipment, ensuring optimal performance and image quality.
* Analyze and interpret echocardiographic images, providing preliminary findings to physicians.
* Document and maintain accurate patient records and imaging results.
* Collaborate with physicians and healthcare staff to discuss imaging findings and patient care.
* Follow all safety protocols and adhere to quality assurance guidelines.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of 1 year of experience as a Registered Echo Technician or Sonographer.
* RDCS certification issued by ARDMS (American Registry for Diagnostic Medical Sonography).
* Must have in-patient experience
* BLS (Basic Life Support) certification preferred.
* Experience in stress testing is a plus.
* Proficiency in operating echocardiography equipment and analyzing cardiac images.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

title: Floating Leasing Professional - Long Island, NY
description:
**ABOUT GREYSTAR**


Greystar is a leading, fully integrated global real estate company offering expertise in property management, investment management, development, and construction services in institutional-quality rental housing, logistics, and life sciences sectors. Headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina, Greystar manages and operates more than $290 billion of real estate in 247 markets globally with offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and the Asia-Pacific region. Greystar is the largest operator of apartments in the United States, manages more than 857,400 units/beds globally, and has a robust institutional investment management platform comprised of more than $76 billion of assets under management, including over $34 billion of development assets. Greystar was founded by Bob Faith in 1993 to become a provider of world-class service in the rental residential real estate business. To learn more, visit www.greystar.com.

**JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**


This position is responsible for coordinating the community’s marketing, leasing, and renewal strategies to achieve occupancy, revenue, and resident retention goals by performing all activities related to leasing to new residents, providing resident satisfaction throughout the term of the lease, and securing resident lease renewals.**JOB DESCRIPTION**


Essential Responsibilities:  

* Performs all sales and leasing activities to achieve the community’s revenue and occupancy goals by greeting and qualifying prospects, conducting community tours and showing apartments, processing applications, credit screening, and criminal background checks, preparing the lease and move-in package, and ensuring a smooth resident move-in and lease signing.
* Inspects apartments prior to resident move-in and ensures apartments are in move-in ready condition and schedules any outstanding item to be addressed with the maintenance team.
* Stays informed about current market and competitor conditions that may impact the community’s occupancy and sales results, develops and implements short- and long-term marketing plans and goals to sustain occupancy, and follows the community’s established policies related to concessions, specials, and other programs to boost occupancy.
* Designs and executes marketing activities to create and drive traffic to the community, including implementing resident referral and employer outreach programs, using internet marketing tools (Craigslist, Facebook, e-mail, and other websites), and following other community-specific marketing plans, drives, and special programs.
* Uses the on-site property management software (OneSite, Yardi, etc.) to track apartment availability, record traffic and leasing activities, manage resident and prospect data, and capture critical demographic and other information about existing and future residents.
* Ensures that the community and show units meet the Company’s standards for show quality by daily inspecting the marketing corridor and leasing tour, communicating maintenance and upkeep needs to the community’s maintenance team members, merchandising and ensuring a physically appealing show unit and/or model and amenities, and preparing the leasing office for daily leasing activities.
* Follows-up with prospects and new residents to ensure satisfaction by sending e-mail, thank-you notes, and cards or making telephone calls or other contacts to finalize decisions to lease and/or renew.
* Executes and performs activities in support of the community’s lease renewal program by preparing lease renewal letters and packages for residents, meeting with and contacting renewing residents in advance of move-out dates, and ensuring that lease renewal documents are signed and implemented on time.
* Responds quickly and courteously to resident and client/owner concerns and questions, and takes prompt action to solve problems and/or document and convey resident or other requests to the appropriate individual(s).

Required Licenses or Certifications:  

* Incumbents must have all licenses and/or certifications as required by State and Local jurisdictions
* Incumbents must have valid driver’s license to operate a golf cart on property.


#LI-SV1


The hourly range for this position is $24.00 - $26.00

**Additional Compensation**:

* *Corporate Positions*: In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible to participate in an annual bonus program based on individual and company performance.
* *Onsite Property Positions*: In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible to participate in weekly, monthly, and/or quarterly bonus programs.

**Robust Benefits Offered\\*:**

* Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Disability & Life insurance benefits. Low (free basic) employee Medical costs for employee-only coverage; costs discounted after 3 and 5 years of service.
* Generous Paid Time off. All new hires start with 15 days of vacation, 4 personal days, 10 sick days, and 10 paid holidays. Plus your birthday off after 1 year of service! Additional vacation accrued with tenure.
* For onsite team members, onsite housing discount at Greystar-managed communities.
* 6-Week Paid Sabbatical after 10 years of service (and every 5 years thereafter).
* 401(k) with Company Match up to 6% of pay after 6 months of service.
* Paid Parental Leave and lifetime Fertility Benefit reimbursement up to $10,000 (includes adoption or surrogacy).
* Employee Assistance Program.
* Critical Illness, Accident, Hospital Indemnity, Pet Insurance and Legal Plans.
* Charitable giving program and benefits.

* *Benefits offered for full-time employees. For Union and Prevailing Wage roles, compensation and benefits may vary from the* *listed information* *above due to Collective Bargaining Agreements and/or local governing authority.*


Greystar will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Resident Lecturer/Program Coordinator
description:
**Position Overview:**  
The School of Chinese Studies at China Institute is seeking a passionate and experienced Chinese language teacher to take on dual roles within the Adult Education Programs: teaching Chinese language classes to adult learners and coordinating both academic and administrative responsibilities, including providing technical support for online classes.

**Responsibilities:**

**Teaching**

* Teach 8-10 class hours per week within the Adult Education Programs, across four semesters annually. Classes are offered at various times, including daytime, evening, and weekends, both online and onsite.
* Provide one-on-one private tutoring as needed.
* Serve as a substitute teacher when required.

**Managing the Private Tutoring Program**

* Independently manage the Private Tutoring Program, including handling inquiries, coordinating with instructors and students, assigning instructors, scheduling sessions, reserving space, and following up as needed.
* Take the initiative to collaborate with the marketing team to promote the PT program

**Academic Development & Administrative Support**

* Conduct ongoing research and implement an up-to-date curriculum, including textbook selection, course design, and resource compilation.
* Maintain the program's Google Drive platform to ensure it is current.
* Collaborate with instructors to develop new courses and maintain a teacher-sharing platform via Google Group, WeChat, or other channels.
* Collect and organize teaching materials and maintain updated folders for special courses.
* Conduct classroom observations for new instructors and courses, and provide feedback afterward.
* Perform placement assessments before each semester begins.
* Support the end-of-term evaluation process, analyze data, and offer suggestions for improvement.
* Stay informed about key developments in relevant fields by participating in professional conferences, workshops, and training sessions.
* Assist the Director of Education in overall administrative operations for the Adult Education Programs, including new initiatives and programs
* Assist in the implementation of marketing efforts, including updating the website, creating newsletters and flyers, and producing other promotional materials.

**Technical Support for Online Classes**

* Set up Zoom meetings for all online classes before each semester and manage Zoom accounts to ensure smooth functionality during classes.
* Train new teachers on using the Zoom platform.
* Be available for troubleshooting during class sessions each semester.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s preferred, in Teaching Chinese as a Second Language, Chinese Language & Literature, Bilingual Education, Applied Linguistics, TESOL, or related fields.
* Native-like proficiency in spoken and written Chinese.
* At least one year of teaching experience, preferably with adult learners of diverse backgrounds and age groups.
* Experience with student-centered, interactive, and communicative teaching approaches.
* Strong passion for and experience in curriculum development and course design.
* Strong academic research skills and familiarity with current developments in teaching Chinese as a second language, assessment, and program evaluation.
* Proficiency in computer and technology applications for online learning, particularly Zoom, Google Classroom, etc.
* Good command of spoken and written English.
* Experience working in an office setting is highly preferred.

title: Ticket Seller
description:
**About us** 

**Welcome to City View Tours And Attraction**! where we transform sightseeing into unforgettable journeys. title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**TITLE: REGISTERED NURSE**

**DEPARTMENT: Assertive Community Treatment (ACT)**

**REPORTS TO: TEAM LEADER**

**JOB SCOPE:**

This is a direct service position requiring specific knowledge of mental health, and skills in crisis intervention and stabilization. As part of the ACT you must be willing to go out into the community to provide services. This position requires clinical experience, and the desire to work as part of a team.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Participates in daily morning meeting.
* Provides medication management and planning/coordination, including injectable medications, to consumers in the community.
* Maintains and updates monthly IM calendar.
* Administer IM's and prepares consumers oral medications for weekly delivery by the clinical team.
* Provides staff education to maintain familiarity with program policies and procedures regarding medication management, and secure record storage.
* Coordinates with Team prescribers and pharmacy to ensure consumers receive medications and refills.
* Transcribe orders and updates Medication Administration Records.
* Logs in medication deliveries and completes toxicology request forms.
* Monitor vital signs and side effects of medications and report findings to the Team Completes annual nursing assessments and daily progress notes.
* Assess for physical health needs, and make appropriate referrals to and collaborate with community physicians
* Performs other duties, consistent with the goals and objectives of the program, as directed by the Team Leader.

**SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:**

* Experience understanding various evidence-based models and theories pertaining to psycho-education, motivational interviewing, serious mental illness and recovery.
* Familiarity with and ability to use an Electronic Health Record system.
* Must be reliable and able to work independently and understand the importance of maintaining confidentiality.
* Ensure progress notes are completed within 24-hours of the delivery of the service and are available to be read in the daily organizational meeting.

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Licensed Registered Nurse in New York in conjunction with either an Associate’s, Bachelor’s or Master’s degree.
* Experience serving the mentally ill/mentally ill chemically addicted (MICA) population.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**

This position operates 80 percent of the time in the community, rotating in an office setting as needed and for team meetings.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

The Americans with Disability Act prohibits discrimination against a qualified individual with a

disability. To be qualified for this position an individual must meet the following standards and/or be able to perform the essential functions and activities.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions for this job. While performing the duties of this job, the physical activities for this position involve:

1. Ability to stand for long periods of time.

2. Ability to walk the building and go up the stairs.

3. Ability to lift and carry weight up to 25 lbs.

4. Good manual dexterity.

5. Ability to travel using public transportation to other PCMH offices or other facilities.

6. Speaking and hearing ability sufficient to communicate effectively by phone or in person at normal

volumes.

7. COVID-19 vaccination

**WORK RELATIONS AND TEAMWORK:**

Understands the relationship of this job to the company’s mission and to other jobs in the company.

Works with co-workers, supervisors, and staff from other departments to solve problems and improve processes and services.

**RESIDENT, CLIENT, GUEST AND STAFF FOCUS:**

Is sensitive to practical, emotional, and spiritual needs of all residents and staff members in all

interactions. Adjust priorities to respond to emergency situations. Keeps relevant staff and

supervisors informed of resident activities or building related issues that require attention.

**OTHER DUTIES:**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of

activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties,

responsibilities and activities may change at any time.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $92,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience in Behavioral Health?
* Will you be willing to work in the community and travel around on a daily basis?

License/Certification:

* RN License (Required)

title: Agent Success I
description:
**About Golden Years Design Benefits**


Golden Years Design Benefits, located in Freehold, New Jersey, is a healthcare agency that specializes in Medicare. The company is licensed in 46 states and has worked with numerous clients in person, online and by phone across the country. The philosophy of Golden Years Design Benefits is to educate clients, while transitioning them from traditional health plans to Medicare plans. Golden Years Design Benefits takes great pride that their clients have remained loyal for three decades and continue to refer friends and family for their healthcare needs. The employees at Golden Years Design Benefits strive to do the very best for all their clients and agents. They have implemented exceptional agent training programs to educate their agents to provide world-class service. For more information, visit www.yourmedicaremarketplace.net.

**Job Summary:** The Receptionist will be the first point of contact for our company. The Receptionist’s duties include offering administrative support across the organization, welcoming guests and greeting people who visit the business. You will coordinate front-desk activities, including distributing correspondence and redirecting phone calls.

 **Primary Responsibilities:**

* Answer Phone calls and direct to appropriate team members
* Assist clients in claims and onboard information for Producers
* Assist Managing Partner with lead generation as the point lead in Facebook Lead Generation
* Assist Managing Partner in Agent Recruitment
* Assist Internal Agent Team on following up and booking leads
* Set Up External Client Facing events and find local opportunities for Business Unit
* Manage Data and CRM
* Assist Managing Partner in setting up CRM to communicate directly with clients 0craete client facing campaigns to cross sell high revenue products - Annuity- Life Insurance etc.
* Participate in weekly team meetings
* Assist Producers in managing retention with Medicare Clients
 **Primary Skills & Requirements:**

* Positive Attitude: Employ an energetic and positive, can-do attitude.
* Understanding of Company Values: Understand and adhere to the organization’s values and ethics.
* Multitasking: Ability to handle multiple tasks and requests at once.
* Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Organizational Skills: Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage numerous projects and priorities at once.
* Customer Service: Strong customer service skills with a focus on delivering a great total customer experience.
* Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Outlook.
* Teamwork: Ability to work well in a team, collaborating with other team members on projects.
**About Integrity**

**Integrity** is one of the nation’s leading independent distributors of life, health and wealth insurance products. With a strong insurtech focus, we embrace a broad and innovative approach to serving agents and clients alike. **Integrity** is driven by a singular purpose: to help people protect their life, health and wealth so they can prepare for the good days ahead.

**Integrity** offers you the opportunity to start a career in a family-like environment that is rewarding and cutting edge. Why? Because we put our people first! At **Integrity,** you can start a new career path at company you’ll love, and we’ll love you back. We’re proud of the work we do and the culture we’ve built, where we celebrate your hard work and support you daily. Joining us means being part of a hyper-growth company with tons of professional opportunities for you to accelerate your career. Integrity offers our people a competitive compensation package, including benefits that make work more fun and give you and your family peace of mind.


Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, **Integrity** is committed to meeting Americans wherever they are — in person, over the phone or online. **Integrity’s** employees support hundreds of thousands of independent agents who serve the needs of millions of clients nationwide. For more information, visit Integrity.com.

*Integrity, LLC is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, Integrity, LLC will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.*

title: Account Based Marketing Manager
description:
**About NewtonX:**
NewtonX is the world’s leading B2B research company. We use proprietary, AI-driven search that scans 1.1 billion professionals across 140 industries to find the exact person to answer any kind of question. A future Series C company, NewtonX has raised $47m in funding. Our research has been cited by Fortune, Forbes, TechCrunch Adweek and more. We partner with insights leaders at McKinsey, Microsoft, Pinterest, Figma and beyond to solve leading organizations' most pressing business challenges. **About the Role:**
We are seeking an experienced and strategic Account-Based Marketing Manager to join our revenue marketing team at NewtonX. As an Account-Based Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing targeted marketing campaigns to drive revenue growth for our key accounts through expansion of current customers as well as new logo acquisition. You will work closely with the sales team to identify target accounts and create customized marketing programs that resonate with each account's unique needs and challenges. **Responsibilities:*** Work closely with the sales team to identify target accounts and develop account-based marketing playbooks that align with the overall business objectives
* Develop customized marketing programs for each target account that include a mix of tactics such as email marketing, content marketing, social media, paid media, landing pages, webinars, events, and more
* Own and scale adoption of Demandbase, teaching the organization to use intent data across the funnel.
* Measure the effectiveness of each marketing program and make data-driven recommendations for optimization
* Collaborate within the Marketing team to create compelling and relevant content that aligns with each account's pain points and interests
* Collaborate with sales reps to create customized nurture sequences for outbound efforts across different roles and industries
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on business impact and timelines
* Work with cross-functional teams, including sales, BDRs, demand generation, and Brand Marketing to ensure alignment and consistency across all marketing efforts
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in account-based marketing and share insights with the broader marketing team

 **Required Qualifications:*** Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field
* Expert knowledge of ABM platforms (Demandbase), marketing automation platforms (Hubspot), CRM systems (Salesforce), and other sales and marketing technology tools
* Experience using paid channels such as LinkedIn and Google for display and search.
* 5+ years of experience in account-based marketing, B2B marketing, or related field
* Demonstrated experience in developing and executing successful account-based marketing programs that drive revenue growth
* Strong project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders at target accounts
* Strong analytical skills and ability to use data and insights to make data-driven decisions
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities and business needs
* Passion for marketing and a drive to continuously learn and improve

 **Benefits*** Competitive compensation (base salary range of 90-110K, annual performance bonus, and employee equity program). Please note that salary range and compensation may vary based on factors such as skills, experience, performance and location.
* Career advancement and development opportunities.
* Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents.
* 401k match with immediate vesting.
* Health savings/flexible savings account, life insurance, and pre-tax commuter benefits.
* Paid time off: vacation, holidays, sick, and parental leave.
* A diverse, collaborative, and positive culture where we invest in and celebrate each other's success.
* Good vibes (happy hours, team projects, and retreats).

  

NewtonX is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Project Manager
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled Project Manager to join our team. As a Project Manager you are responsible for organizing, outlining and developing projects. This includes design of the project goals and success factors, determination of how success will be measured and tracked. You will be responsible for ensuring the project remains on time and on budget and help motivate team members to hit their goals. The role requires overseeing the cross functional team ensuring deliverables are identified and committed time frames are met. All relevant meetings will be scheduled, and meeting notes circulated. Action items will be tracked, and project plans developed. All risks must be monitored and escalated to allow for course change or corrective actions. The PM will lead periodic readouts on project status. The PM will work closely with the financial contact to ensure all relevant financial information is a part of the project management process.

As Project manager you will work closely with users, understand the business and the way in which they use our various software platforms. You will work closely with the business analyst and other stakeholders to ensure requirements are complete and clearly communicated. Once the requirements are complete, you will act as liaison to the development and QA teams to help communicate the requirements, drive the implementation of the project and facilitate the new functionality as it makes its way through the SDLC.

**Duties**

* Responsible for overall Project implementation from ideation through implementation while driving the success of the project
* Develop comprehensive project plans to be shared with stakeholders
* Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short- and long-term goals while motivating team members to hit their goals
* Meet budgetary objectives and make adjustments to project constraints based on financial analysis
* Holding periodic Readouts on Project status and risks
* Identify with the financial partner the key financial deliverables and install measurement to track post project launch
* Learn our various software platforms and gain a deep understanding of the underlying functionality
* Constantly look for ways to improve the usability and efficiency of the applications and make suggestions for improvement
* Use and continually develop leadership skills
* Compliance with the provisions of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 and its implementing regulations, as amended (“HIPAA”)

**Qualifications**

* At least 5 years previous experience working as a Project Manager in the pharmacy or health care industry
* PMP Certification
* Strong communication and documentation skills with a proven ability to be thorough when thinking through technical changes
* Working knowledge SCRUM and use cases and their use in a QA environment
* Understand the difference between Unit testing, Functional testing, User acceptance testing, Regression testing
* Experience working with SDLC tools such as Jira & Confluence
* Familiarity with software's collaboration and time management tools
* Experience with process improvement and implementation
* Advanced time management and analytical skills
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Project & PowerPoint
* Excellent client-facing communication skills
* Ability to query SQL database tables and understand database structures and concepts is desired
* A degree in Computer Science or similar IT related field

* Saturday 9am-12pm

  

Enterprise Mobility operates the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands and has frequently been named one of the top places to work. Enterprise Mobility is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in North America and we are hiring now!  

We are committed to maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness in the industry, and as an Auto Detailer and Car Washer you will be at the forefront of our Complete Clean Pledge, going above and beyond our already rigorous cleaning protocols, to protect the health and safety of all.  

From trucks to vans to cars of all sizes you will be responsible for washing, cleaning, sanitizing, inspecting, and preparing your branch's vehicles in accordance with our Complete Clean Pledge, ensuring that all vehicles rented by our customers are safe and clean. **Responsibilities:**  

We are hiring now for immediate openings. Responsibilities include:* Clean and sanitize vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
* Vacuum and prepare vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
* Wash, clean and dry the vehicle's exterior - this might include cars of different sizes, as well as vans and trucks.
* Check fuel level and warning lights: inspect windshield for damage; factory reset/restore vehicle setting to clear prior customer data; check for customer items and place anything of value in Lost & Found; verify that registration is present, current and matches the license plate.
* Check fluid levels and add as needed; check tire condition, pressure and tread depth; inspect vehicle exterior for damage
* Fuel and stage vehicle
* Inspect vehicle for any safety concerns; report any warning lights and/or vehicle/windshield/tire damage; pull vehicle out of the prep processing as necessary
* Maintains a clean and orderly work area and report any unsafe or hazardous conditions
* Responsible for wearing proper personal protection equipment (PPE) and ensuring cleaning, detailing, washing and sanitization supplies are available
* Assists customers when needed. May transport customers to and from the branches
* Helps maintain overall site appearance including general cleaning of interior and exteriors of branch locations
* Site appearance responsibilities to include: desktops, countertops, phones, floors, trash, bathrooms, vacuuming, sweeping the lot and any other miscellaneous tasks related to the daily cleanliness of the branch location


Additional Responsibilities* Seek to improve job performance through self-assessment, skill development, training and goal setting
* Maintain a regular and reliable level of attendance and punctuality
* Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

*Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans* **Qualifications:**  

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* The ability to operate a motor vehicle is an essential function of this position. Applicants must have a valid, unrestricted driver's license
* Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship from our company for an employment based work permit or other work authorization document now or in the future
* Must be able to read, write, and speak English
* Must be living within a reasonable commute of no more than 1 hour from this location
* Must have at least six (6) consecutive months of prior work/organizational experience
company_description: We are paving a new way forward by creating better experiences for how we move.

title: Housekeeper
description:
***GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO BECOME PART OF THE VITAQUEST FAMILY!***

Welcome to Vitaquest International, a leading development and commercialization partner for consumer products in the nutraceutical and functional foods industry. With a rich history spanning over 40 years, Vitaquest offers unparalleled market insights, global reach, and seamless execution in every phase, from concept to shelf. With more than 4,000 customer formulas for over 500 brands across 40 countries, we are committed to delivering exceptional results to our clients.

At Vitaquest, we believe in cultivating a culture of productivity and engagement among our employees through our internal communications plan known as Vitaquest PROUD. We understand that each employee plays an integral role in our organization's growth and success, and we seek individuals who share our passion for innovation and take pride in being part of our company. Join us in shaping the future of the nutraceutical industry and make a meaningful impact on the lives of millions around the world.

* **Title: Housekeeper 1st shift**
* **Department:** Sanitation
* **Reports To:** Sanitation Supervisor
* **Shift: 6:00 am to 2:30 pm / Monday through Friday**

**Housekeeper / Porter Position Purpose and Objectives**

* The purpose of this position is to provide cleaning and sanitation support to all areas of operation.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Clean and sanitize manufacturing equipment and parts that are sent to the washroom.
* Clean and sanitize stationary manufacturing equipment and parts.
* Clean and sanitize production rooms and packaging suites.
* Clean and sanitize ancillary areas and warehouses in accordance with the Master Sanitation Schedule..
* Operate and maintain the Tennant T5 Floor Scrubbers.
* Police the exterior of the buildings to maintain a clean and neat appearance.
* Perform weekly sink and drain sanitation.
* Clean and maintain backpack vacuums and shop-vacs used in production areas.
* Maintain cleaning equipment to ensure it is clean and damage free.
* Maintain adequate inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment.
* Document all cleaning and sanitizing activities in applicable logbooks or log sheets.
* Maintain compliance with all training assignments and complete computer-based training on relevant SOP’s and cGMPs in a timely manner.
* Must be aware of the relevance and importance of their individual activities in contributing to ViaQuest’s commitment to Food Safety.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required**

* Ability to communicate effectively with various departments, managers and staff.
* Must be proficient in current Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) as they relate to cleaning and sanitizing activities.
* Must be well organized and detail oriented.
* Ability to express his ideas and thoughts both verbally and in writing.
* Must be well-focused and able to complete tasks in time frames specified by management.
* Must be able to document information in a clear and legible manner.
* Able to work independently and efficiently with minimal supervision.

**Supervisory Responsibility**

**N/A**

**Working Conditions**

* A dynamic and fast paced environment. Rapid response to a given task is essential. Able to lift up to 50 lbs 30 % of the time. Individuals must seek assistance when handling objects in excess of 50 lbs.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Good verbal and written communication skills,
* Detail oriented, well-focused, can complete tasks in timely manner.

**Success Factors:**

* **Well organized**
* **Self-Motivated**
* **Team player**
* **Honest**
* **Ability to communicate verbally and in written form.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Night shift

Experience:

* Cleaning: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)

title: Director of Patient Services
company: The Garden of Eden Assisted Living Facility
description:
**Job Summary:**  
The assisted living facility in Bensonhurst is seeking a dedicated and compassionate individual for the position of Director of Patient Services. Director of Patient Services is responsible for the daily planning, organizing, and evaluating Patient service programs and support functions. The ideal candidate is a licensed and currently registered professional nurse with at least two years supervisory experience. This position reports to administrator.

**Responsibilities:**

· Hire, orient, and supervise all professional staff reporting to position.

· Coordinate and integrate care provided by facility staff, including contractual providers.

· Demonstrate competency with the State Survey process and ensure that the agency as a whole and all the agency staff are prepared for on-site surveys and other external audits.

· Conduct Clinical Quality Improvement (CQI) functions and report to the Quality Improvement Committee (QIC).

· Review infection control reports for all clients. Provide all follow up related to infection control reports (both client and employee), process these reports in appropriate database and ensure clinical managers and supervisors are reviewing for their teams.

· Collaborate on the development and implementation of policies and procedures that guide and support the provision of care.

· Assign work to staff, ensure patients records are current, complete, and care provided in accordance with established treatment plan.

· Ensure ongoing and appropriate clinical supervision including documented competency and annual performance evaluation for all staff.

· Identify staff education needs, prepare annual in-service plan and secure appropriate training resources.

· Implement system to monitor patient satisfaction, including complains and incidents; review and follow-up on all QI reports; maintain administrative logs.

· Act as liaison between nursing and billing staff to ensure timely submission of claims to third party payors.

· Demonstrate availability of self or designee at all times in person or via telecommunications.

· Ensure that clients’ Plans of Care are executed as written.

· Ensure a reassessment of a client's needs is performed by the appropriate healthcare professional when there is a significant health status change in the patient's condition.

**Qualifications:**

· Currently licensed and registered to practice as an RN by the New York State Education Department

· BSN Degree

· Knowledge and experience of UAS

· Knowledge and experience of Assisted living NYS regulations.

· Minimum of 2 years previous experience in Assisted living facility or Home Care

· Minimum of 2 years experience as a Supervising Community Health Nurse

· Demonstrate outstanding leadership skills and interpersonal skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* RN License (Required)

description:

The ideal candidate for this position must have a high energy level, a desire to work in a fast paced environment, a valid and clean driver’s license, and can drive both manual and automatic transmissions. He or she must be able to work productively team environment and must have a positive attitude, professional appearance, great communication skills, and the ability to deliver world class customer service. As a Lot Attendant/Service Porter/Driver you will be responsible for taking care of vehicles and customers in the service drive.

Greet and assist customers dropping off vehicles for repairs.

Services vehicles with gas.

Install disposable covers and floor mats in vehicle interiors being serviced. Sanitize vehicle.

Maintain internal and external appearance and cleanliness of the store, showroom, service and lot.

Perform other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

Valid driver’s license and clean driving record

Able to safely operate motor vehicles in tight and small spaces

Operate a wide variety of cars, light trucks, and vans, with ability to drive both manual and automatic transmissions

A team player who is focused on providing exemplary customer service

Exemplary work ethic

Neat, clean and professional appearance

Effective interpersonal communication skills with ability to interact with customers, vendors and staff

Paid time off

Paid Training

Employee Discount

title: Dialysis Nurse
description:
Homecare Dialysis Nurse - Private Case in Greenwich, CT

Position: Homecare Dialysis Nurse  
Location: Greenwich, CT  
Employment Type: Part-time/Full-time

About Us:  
We are a dedicated healthcare provider offering personalized care solutions to patients in the comfort of their homes. Our mission is to enhance the quality of life for our clients through compassionate and skilled nursing care.

Position Overview:  
We are seeking a compassionate and experienced Homecare Dialysis Nurse to join our team for a private case in Greenwich, CT. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in dialysis care, providing exceptional support to patients undergoing treatment in their home environment.

Pay rate $65-$75/hr RN

Responsibilities:

* Administer dialysis treatments and monitor patients’ responses. M-W-F
* Assess patients' overall health and vital signs before, during, and after treatment.
* Educate patients and their families on dialysis processes, home care, and lifestyle adjustments.
* Collaborate with healthcare professionals to create and implement individualized care plans.
* Maintain accurate patient records and documentation in compliance with regulations.
* Provide emotional support and encouragement to patients and families.

Qualifications:

* Current RN license in the state of Connecticut.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in dialysis nursing or related field.
* Strong clinical skills and knowledge of dialysis procedures.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Compassionate, patient-centered approach to care.

Benefits:

* Competitive salary.
* Flexible scheduling options.
* Supportive work environment with ongoing training opportunities.
* Opportunity to make a meaningful difference in patients’ lives.

How to Apply:  
If you are a dedicated and experienced dialysis nurse looking to provide compassionate care in a home setting, we want to hear from you! Please send your resume and a brief cover letter to job@professionalnursingllc.com or call us at (888)967-8233 for more information.

Join us in making a positive impact in the lives of our patients in Greenwich, CT!

Professional Nursing Service is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Retail Sales Associate to join our dynamic team. As a key member of our sales team, you will be responsible for driving sales growth, providing exceptional customer service, and maintaining a positive store environment. This is an exciting opportunity to develop your retail skills and build a successful career in a fast-paced and competitive industry. Tuesday through Saturday work week.

Duties:

* Provide outstanding customer service by greeting customers, answering their questions, and helping them find the products they need.
* Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the products and services offered by the store, and be able to provide accurate information to customers.
* Utilize strong sales skills to identify and pursue sales opportunities, and make recommendations to customers.
* Operate POS cash register efficiently and accurately, handling cash and credit transactions.
* Maintain a clean and organized store environment by stocking shelves, facing merchandise, and performing other duties as required.
* Participate in product demos and assist customers with product inquiries.
* Handle customer complaints and concerns in a professional and courteous manner.
* Utilize effective phone etiquette to handle customer inquiries and resolve issues.
* Meet or exceed sales targets and contribute to the overall success of the store.
* Collaborate with colleagues to achieve team goals and maintain a positive store atmosphere.
* Perform other duties as required to support the smooth operation of the store.

Experience:  
Ideal candidates will have experience in retail sales, with a strong background in customer service and cash handling. A high school diploma or equivalent is required, and experience in using a cash register is essential.

Skills:

* Proficiency in basic math and retail math.
* Experience with cash handling and operating a POS cash register.
* Strong sales skills and the ability to sell products effectively a plus.
* Excellent phone etiquette and customer service skills.
* Ability to demonstrate products and answer customer questions.
* Strong product knowledge a plus but not needed and the ability to learn quickly.

title: Substance Abuse Prevention and Intervention Specialist L2 - Benjamin N. Cardozo High School (26Q415)
description:
**Substance Abuse Prevention and Intervention Specialist L2 - Benjamin N. Cardozo High School (26Q415)**
========================================================================================================

Posted Date: Aug 29, 2024 Deadline: Sep 9, 2024
**Job Details**
---------------


**Position Summary:**
---------------------

This position encompasses work related to providing professional services to students in substance abuse prevention and intervention programs.


**Duties and Responsibilities – Level 2**
-----------------------------------------

  

Coordinates substance and alcohol prevention services designed to reach students and parents for the purpose of reinforcing positive attitudes through an educational program. Provides a variety of intervention services in the form of individual, group or family sessions to assist in high need crisis intervention where individual students are seen because of an immediate problem. Conducts workshops that offer parents and community residents an opportunity to become involved in their school’s program. Serves as liaison to the regional personnel, school faculty, parent groups and outside agencies to deal with student substance and alcohol abuse problems. Prepares and maintains necessary program reports and fiscal documents.

  



**Minimum Selection Criteria – Level 2**
----------------------------------------

  

* Master’s degree from an accredited college plus one year satisfactory full-time experience in a drug or alcohol abuse program or counseling experience; or
* Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college plus two years of satisfactory full-time experience in a drug or alcohol abuse program or counseling experience; or
* Associate degree or a minimum of 60 college course credits from an accredited college plus four years of satisfactory full-time experience in a drug or alcohol abuse program or counseling experience; or
* A satisfactory equivalent combination of education and/or experience. However, all candidates must possess a high school diploma or its educational equivalent.

**Salary:**
-----------


$60,575 (New Hire Minimum)


$69,662 (2 Years Prior Service Minimum)

**Application:**
----------------

Please send cover letter and resume, no later than **September 09, 2024**, to:  

  



Jennifer Hecker, Prevention Program Director


JHecker@schools.nyc.gov

**NOTE: The filling of all positions is subject to budget availability.**

---------------------------------------

title: Associate Recruiter
description:
Salary Range $62,400 - $80,200\\*
  
  

**Job Description:**  

Who We Are
  
  

Saks is a world-renowned luxury ecommerce destination. The company’s unique approach combines a focus on the digital customer experience with a strong connection to a network of extraordinary stores that extends that seamless experience into the real world.
  
  

On its website and app, Saks offers an unparalleled selection of curated merchandise across fashion for women and men, beauty, jewelry, home décor and more. In addition to the shopping experience, customers come to Saks for inspiring editorial content, access to digital stylists, lifestyle experiences and other world-class services.
  
  

**Role Summary:**  

The Associate Recruiter is an innovative, strategic, passionate Talent Acquisition Partner who reports into the Talent Acquisition Manager for Saks Global. This person is responsible for the recruitment and selection activities across the Merchandising (Buying & Planning) and Marketing functions for high volume roles. The Associate Recruiter will manage full cycle recruitment and be expected to develop new sourcing and recruiting strategies, building a diverse pipeline of qualified and capable talent for the organization.
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

You are passionate about People and identifying talent
  
  

You are a developing a strong brand as a proven talent acquisition professional invested in partnering with clients to find diverse talent for their roles
  
  

You are an excellent communicator, possess strong networking capabilities and have familiarity with behavior based interview techniques
  
  

You are highly organized and able to plan and maintain a complex calendar
  
  

You have proven results influencing and collaborating with a diverse client group in a large organization
  
  

**Key Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s Degree
  
  

Minimum 2-3 years experience in talent acquisition (experience in retail/fashion recruiting is a plus)
  
  

Experience using Google Suite is preferred
  
  

Previous experience with Applicant Tracking systems and Candidate Relationship Management tools
  
  

**Role Description:**  

**Manage full cycle recruitment:** This includes, but is not limited to; research, sourcing (cold-calling), pre-screening, interviewing, qualifying, referencing, offer negotiation and placement management for early career level and high volume hires (i.e. individual contributor roles).
  
  

**Build strong internal relationships:** Collaborate with People Business Partners and Hiring Managers to recommend, develop and implement recruitment strategies and programs. Build and present reporting analytics & talent maps for difficult searches.
  
  

**Develop external relationships:** Build and maintain critical role candidate pipelines and present findings to key Hiring Managers and People Business Partners. Attend networking events and learning seminars to develop strong pipelines while developing a strong presence.
  
  

**Maintain top results and strive for excellence:** Always meet or exceed recruiting metrics set out for the function.
  
  

**Identify Opportunities:** Participate as an active member of the Talent Acquisition team, assisting with the development and realization of the Talent Acquisition strategic plans and goals.
  
  

**Exhibits a passion for growth:** Participate in professional development activities to gain new skills and bring new insights to the team, striving to grow your career at Saks.
  
  

**Your Life and Career at Saks:**  

Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities
  
  

A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  
  

Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  
  

An amazing employee discount
  
  

Thank you for your interest with Saks. We look forward to reviewing your application.
  
  

Saks provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Saks complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
  
  

Saks welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.
  
  

Saks.com is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
  
  

* The above expected salary range may have some variability based upon factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s overall experience, qualifications, and geographic location. If you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply and, if selected to move forward in the interview process, you will have a chance to speak with our recruitment team regarding your specific salary expectations.

title: CHHA (Certified Home Health Aide)
description:
BrightStar Care of Westfield and Summit is ***immediately hiring hourly caregivers*** **(CHHAs)** to service our elderly clients living in Union County. **An active NJ CHHA license is required**.

We are seeking *compassionate*, *reliable & experienced,* NJ Certified Home Health Aides (CHHAs), who are ready and eager to work and want to join our team! If you have a *positive attitude, are patient, caring, honest, and serve with passion , then we want to speak with you.*

We offer the benefits you need, and we will work with you, to get the hours you want to fit your schedule. Apply today and we will contact you for a phone interview asap if qualified.

Our wonderful elderly clients living in **Union County**

**The following is required for this position:**

* *Must have an active NJ CHHA license*
* ***Must be fluent in the English language - speaking, understanding, reading and writing***
* Must drive - valid driver's license & must own a reliable personal vehicle
* *Willing to travel to clients living anywhere in Union County*
* Ability to pass a background check & drug screening
* Must be passionate about helping others and working with the elderly population
* At least 1 year of professional experience caring for the elderly is preferred

**What benefits do we offer?**

* Opportunity to build your own schedule
* NEW! Rewards and Recognition gift card program!
* Stable, consistent work available
* Unlimited *$400 Refer a Friend Bonus* after they work 80 hours
* Paid Orientation
* Top Performer Bonuses
* Up to 3 weeks Paid Time Off
* Weekly pay with direct deposit every Friday
* 13 annual holidays paid at time & a half if you work that day
* We work with our caregivers to accommodate them based on availability, skills & location preference
* Employee of the month with *Bonus*
* Supportive Care Team - Our Home Health Aides love working with us!
* Mileage reimbursement between cases
* Voted 2018 -2024 Best of Home Care Employer of Choice!
* We offer 24/7 Support- we are here when you need us!

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist with personal care such as bathing, dressing, ambulation, and transfers
* Accompany clients to the grocery store, doctor appointments and pharmacy visits
* Assisting client with active and passive mobility work defined by the plan of care, and documenting observed changes to the Director of Nursing

**Requirements:**

* Valid New Jersey CHHA license in good standing
* High school diploma or GED
* Valid CPR Certificate or willing to get one
* Negative drug screen and clear background check
* Driver's license and reliable vehicle
* Ability to read, write, speak and understand English and communicate effectively
* Must be able to stand, walk, squat, bend, kneel, reach, twist, push and pull. Varied assistance is required depending on the mobility of the client. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

BrightStar Care of Westfield & Summit is an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Per diem

Pay: $18.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Continuing education credits
* Flexible schedule
* Mileage reimbursement
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid orientation
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Referral program
* Safety equipment provided
* Travel reimbursement

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health

* Do you have an ACTIVE NJ CHHA license?
* Do you have a drivers license and own a reliable vehicle?
* What is the best number to reach you?
* What do you like about being a caregiver?
* Are you able to read, write, speak and understand the English language?

Experience:

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Hospital At Home
description:
**Registered Nurse - (RN) Hospital At Home**

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

Come join our team! We are working with a world-renowned hospital system to expand an innovative new Hospital at Home program. We are hiring highly skilled Registered Nurses (RNs) with Intensive Care Unit (ICU) and/or Emergency Room (ER) experience to support this exciting initiative! As an integral member of our healthcare team, the RN will play a crucial role in delivering exceptional patient care and promoting well-being in the comfort of patients’ homes.

**Benefits:** 

* Competitive Pay
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Weekly Pay with Direct Deposit
* Schedule Flexibility
* Work in a home setting with one-on-one patient care
* Referral Bonuses
* Comprehensive training & support 24/7

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide compassionate and comprehensive nursing care to patients in their homes, ensuring the highest standards of clinical excellence and patient safety.
* Conduct thorough assessments, develop individualized care plans, and implement evidence-based practices to address patients’ unique healthcare needs.
* Administer medications, treatments, and procedures with precision, adhering to prescribed protocols and guidelines.
* Monitor patients’ condition closely. Recognizing any changes or complications and taking appropriate action to prevent deterioration.
* Collaborate with physicians, therapists, and other healthcare professionals to establish coordinated care strategies, optimizing patient outcomes.
* Educate patients and their families on disease management, self-care techniques, and medication regimens, fostering a sense of empowerment and active involvement in the healing process.
* Utilize advanced technology and telemedicine tools to facilitate remote monitoring and consultations, ensuring seamless communication with the healthcare team.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, documentation, and progress notes, in compliance with regulatory standards and company policies.
* Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities to enhance clinical knowledge and stay informed about emerging healthcare trends and best practices.
* Adhere to ethical and legal principles, maintaining confidentiality and respecting patients’ rights throughout the care journey

**Requirements:** 

* Valid and unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New Jersey or Nurse Licensure Compact (NLC).
* Bachelor’s degree in nursing (BSN) preferred; associate degree in nursing (ADN) accepted with relevant experience.
* Minimum of 2 years of clinical experience in a fast-paced ICU or ER setting, excellent vascular access skills, showcasing a strong clinical acumen (infusions, wound care, etc.) and critical thinking skills. Ultrasound guided IV skills a major plus.
* Comfortable utilizing technology to determine scheduling, providing care, and reporting patient results.
* Willingness to travel locally (Union County) to care for patients
* Dedication to delivering patient-centered care, with an emphasis on compassion, empathy, and dignity.

Pay Rates:

Monday through Friday (2-hour visits)

Next Day ($57 per hour)

Same Day ($62.50 per hour)

Saturday and Sunday (2- hour visits)

Next Day ($60 per hour)

Same Day ($65 per hour)

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. Every Brightstar Care agency is independently owned

Pay: $57.00 - $65.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Travel reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health
* Hospital Medicine

Application Question(s):

* Do you have superior vascular access skills ?

Experience:

* Nursing: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Union County, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

description:
**Qualification:** High School or Equivalent; 2 - 3 years Parts department retail or warehouse inventory control experience
